14115 return (dp);
14116
14117err:
14118 kmem_free(dp->dtdo_buf, dp->dtdo_len * sizeof (dif_instr_t));
14119 kmem_free(dp->dtdo_inttab, dp->dtdo_intlen * sizeof (uint64_t));
14120 kmem_free(dp->dtdo_strtab, dp->dtdo_strlen);
14121 kmem_free(dp->dtdo_vartab, dp->dtdo_varlen * sizeof (dtrace_difv_t));
14122
14123 kmem_free(dp, sizeof (dtrace_difo_t));
14124 return (NULL);
14125}
14126
14127static dtrace_predicate_t *
14128dtrace_dof_predicate(dof_hdr_t *dof, dof_sec_t *sec, dtrace_vstate_t *vstate,
14129 cred_t *cr)
14130{
14131 dtrace_difo_t *dp;
14132
14133 if ((dp = dtrace_dof_difo(dof, sec, vstate, cr)) == NULL)
14134 return (NULL);
14135
14136 return (dtrace_predicate_create(dp));
14137}
14138
14139static dtrace_actdesc_t *
14140dtrace_dof_actdesc(dof_hdr_t *dof, dof_sec_t *sec, dtrace_vstate_t *vstate,
14141 cred_t *cr)
14142{
14143 dtrace_actdesc_t *act, *first = NULL, *last = NULL, *next;
14144 dof_actdesc_t *desc;
14145 dof_sec_t *difosec;
14146 size_t offs;
14147 uintptr_t daddr = (uintptr_t)dof;
14148 uint64_t arg;
14149 dtrace_actkind_t kind;
14150
14151 if (sec->dofs_type != DOF_SECT_ACTDESC) {
14152 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid action section");
14153 return (NULL);
14154 }
14155
14156 if (sec->dofs_offset + sizeof (dof_actdesc_t) > dof->dofh_loadsz) {
14157 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "truncated action description");
14158 return (NULL);
14159 }
14160
14161 if (sec->dofs_align != sizeof (uint64_t)) {
14162 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad alignment in action description");
14163 return (NULL);
14164 }
14165
14166 if (sec->dofs_size < sec->dofs_entsize) {
14167 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "section entry size exceeds total size");
14168 return (NULL);
14169 }
14170
14171 if (sec->dofs_entsize != sizeof (dof_actdesc_t)) {
14172 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad entry size in action description");
14173 return (NULL);
14174 }
14175
14176 if (sec->dofs_size / sec->dofs_entsize > dtrace_actions_max) {
14177 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "actions exceed dtrace_actions_max");
14178 return (NULL);
14179 }
14180
14181 for (offs = 0; offs < sec->dofs_size; offs += sec->dofs_entsize) {
14182 desc = (dof_actdesc_t *)(daddr +
14183 (uintptr_t)sec->dofs_offset + offs);
14184 kind = (dtrace_actkind_t)desc->dofa_kind;
14185
14186 if ((DTRACEACT_ISPRINTFLIKE(kind) &&
14187 (kind != DTRACEACT_PRINTA ||
14188 desc->dofa_strtab != DOF_SECIDX_NONE)) ||
14189 (kind == DTRACEACT_DIFEXPR &&
14190 desc->dofa_strtab != DOF_SECIDX_NONE)) {
14191 dof_sec_t *strtab;
14192 char *str, *fmt;
14193 uint64_t i;
14194
14195 /*
14196 * The argument to these actions is an index into the
14197 * DOF string table. For printf()-like actions, this
14198 * is the format string. For print(), this is the
14199 * CTF type of the expression result.
14200 */
14201 if ((strtab = dtrace_dof_sect(dof,
14202 DOF_SECT_STRTAB, desc->dofa_strtab)) == NULL)
14203 goto err;
14204
14205 str = (char *)((uintptr_t)dof +
14206 (uintptr_t)strtab->dofs_offset);
14207
14208 for (i = desc->dofa_arg; i < strtab->dofs_size; i++) {
14209 if (str[i] == '\0')
14210 break;
14211 }
14212
14213 if (i >= strtab->dofs_size) {
14214 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bogus format string");
14215 goto err;
14216 }
14217
14218 if (i == desc->dofa_arg) {
14219 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "empty format string");
14220 goto err;
14221 }
14222
14223 i -= desc->dofa_arg;
14224 fmt = kmem_alloc(i + 1, KM_SLEEP);
14225 bcopy(&str[desc->dofa_arg], fmt, i + 1);
14226 arg = (uint64_t)(uintptr_t)fmt;
14227 } else {
14228 if (kind == DTRACEACT_PRINTA) {
14229 ASSERT(desc->dofa_strtab == DOF_SECIDX_NONE);
14230 arg = 0;
14231 } else {
14232 arg = desc->dofa_arg;
14233 }
14234 }
14235
14236 act = dtrace_actdesc_create(kind, desc->dofa_ntuple,
14237 desc->dofa_uarg, arg);
14238
14239 if (last != NULL) {
14240 last->dtad_next = act;
14241 } else {
14242 first = act;
14243 }
14244
14245 last = act;
14246
14247 if (desc->dofa_difo == DOF_SECIDX_NONE)
14248 continue;
14249
14250 if ((difosec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof,
14251 DOF_SECT_DIFOHDR, desc->dofa_difo)) == NULL)
14252 goto err;
14253
14254 act->dtad_difo = dtrace_dof_difo(dof, difosec, vstate, cr);
14255
14256 if (act->dtad_difo == NULL)
14257 goto err;
14258 }
14259
14260 ASSERT(first != NULL);
14261 return (first);
14262
14263err:
14264 for (act = first; act != NULL; act = next) {
14265 next = act->dtad_next;
14266 dtrace_actdesc_release(act, vstate);
14267 }
14268
14269 return (NULL);
14270}
14271
14272static dtrace_ecbdesc_t *
14273dtrace_dof_ecbdesc(dof_hdr_t *dof, dof_sec_t *sec, dtrace_vstate_t *vstate,
14274 cred_t *cr)
14275{
14276 dtrace_ecbdesc_t *ep;
14277 dof_ecbdesc_t *ecb;
14278 dtrace_probedesc_t *desc;
14279 dtrace_predicate_t *pred = NULL;
14280
14281 if (sec->dofs_size < sizeof (dof_ecbdesc_t)) {
14282 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "truncated ECB description");
14283 return (NULL);
14284 }
14285
14286 if (sec->dofs_align != sizeof (uint64_t)) {
14287 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad alignment in ECB description");
14288 return (NULL);
14289 }
14290
14291 ecb = (dof_ecbdesc_t *)((uintptr_t)dof + (uintptr_t)sec->dofs_offset);
14292 sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_PROBEDESC, ecb->dofe_probes);
14293
14294 if (sec == NULL)
14295 return (NULL);
14296
14297 ep = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_ecbdesc_t), KM_SLEEP);
14298 ep->dted_uarg = ecb->dofe_uarg;
14299 desc = &ep->dted_probe;
14300
14301 if (dtrace_dof_probedesc(dof, sec, desc) == NULL)
14302 goto err;
14303
14304 if (ecb->dofe_pred != DOF_SECIDX_NONE) {
14305 if ((sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof,
14306 DOF_SECT_DIFOHDR, ecb->dofe_pred)) == NULL)
14307 goto err;
14308
14309 if ((pred = dtrace_dof_predicate(dof, sec, vstate, cr)) == NULL)
14310 goto err;
14311
14312 ep->dted_pred.dtpdd_predicate = pred;
14313 }
14314
14315 if (ecb->dofe_actions != DOF_SECIDX_NONE) {
14316 if ((sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof,
14317 DOF_SECT_ACTDESC, ecb->dofe_actions)) == NULL)
14318 goto err;
14319
14320 ep->dted_action = dtrace_dof_actdesc(dof, sec, vstate, cr);
14321
14322 if (ep->dted_action == NULL)
14323 goto err;
14324 }
14325
14326 return (ep);
14327
14328err:
14329 if (pred != NULL)
14330 dtrace_predicate_release(pred, vstate);
14331 kmem_free(ep, sizeof (dtrace_ecbdesc_t));
14332 return (NULL);
14333}
14334
14335/*
14336 * Apply the relocations from the specified 'sec' (a DOF_SECT_URELHDR) to the
14337 * specified DOF. SETX relocations are computed using 'ubase', the base load
14338 * address of the object containing the DOF, and DOFREL relocations are relative
14339 * to the relocation offset within the DOF.
14340 */
14341static int
14342dtrace_dof_relocate(dof_hdr_t *dof, dof_sec_t *sec, uint64_t ubase,
14343 uint64_t udaddr)
14344{
14345 uintptr_t daddr = (uintptr_t)dof;
14346 dof_relohdr_t *dofr =
14347 (dof_relohdr_t *)(uintptr_t)(daddr + sec->dofs_offset);
14348 dof_sec_t *ss, *rs, *ts;
14349 dof_relodesc_t *r;
14350 uint_t i, n;
14351
14352 if (sec->dofs_size < sizeof (dof_relohdr_t) ||
14353 sec->dofs_align != sizeof (dof_secidx_t)) {
14354 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid relocation header");
14355 return (-1);
14356 }
14357
14358 ss = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_STRTAB, dofr->dofr_strtab);
14359 rs = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_RELTAB, dofr->dofr_relsec);
14360 ts = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_NONE, dofr->dofr_tgtsec);
14361
14362 if (ss == NULL || rs == NULL || ts == NULL)
14363 return (-1); /* dtrace_dof_error() has been called already */
14364
14365 if (rs->dofs_entsize < sizeof (dof_relodesc_t) ||
14366 rs->dofs_align != sizeof (uint64_t)) {
14367 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid relocation section");
14368 return (-1);
14369 }
14370
14371 r = (dof_relodesc_t *)(uintptr_t)(daddr + rs->dofs_offset);
14372 n = rs->dofs_size / rs->dofs_entsize;
14373
14374 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
14375 uintptr_t taddr = daddr + ts->dofs_offset + r->dofr_offset;
14376
14377 switch (r->dofr_type) {
14378 case DOF_RELO_NONE:
14379 break;
14380 case DOF_RELO_SETX:
14381 case DOF_RELO_DOFREL:
14382 if (r->dofr_offset >= ts->dofs_size || r->dofr_offset +
14383 sizeof (uint64_t) > ts->dofs_size) {
14384 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad relocation offset");
14385 return (-1);
14386 }
14387
14388 if (!IS_P2ALIGNED(taddr, sizeof (uint64_t))) {
14389 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned setx relo");
14390 return (-1);
14391 }
14392
14393 if (r->dofr_type == DOF_RELO_SETX)
14394 *(uint64_t *)taddr += ubase;
14395 else
14396 *(uint64_t *)taddr +=
14397 udaddr + ts->dofs_offset + r->dofr_offset;
14398 break;
14399 default:
14400 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid relocation type");
14401 return (-1);
14402 }
14403
14404 r = (dof_relodesc_t *)((uintptr_t)r + rs->dofs_entsize);
14405 }
14406
14407 return (0);
14408}
14409
14410/*
14411 * The dof_hdr_t passed to dtrace_dof_slurp() should be a partially validated
14412 * header: it should be at the front of a memory region that is at least
14413 * sizeof (dof_hdr_t) in size -- and then at least dof_hdr.dofh_loadsz in
14414 * size. It need not be validated in any other way.
14415 */
14416static int
14417dtrace_dof_slurp(dof_hdr_t *dof, dtrace_vstate_t *vstate, cred_t *cr,
14418 dtrace_enabling_t **enabp, uint64_t ubase, uint64_t udaddr, int noprobes)
14419{
14420 uint64_t len = dof->dofh_loadsz, seclen;
14421 uintptr_t daddr = (uintptr_t)dof;
14422 dtrace_ecbdesc_t *ep;
14423 dtrace_enabling_t *enab;
14424 uint_t i;
14425
14426 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
14427 ASSERT(dof->dofh_loadsz >= sizeof (dof_hdr_t));
14428
14429 /*
14430 * Check the DOF header identification bytes. In addition to checking
14431 * valid settings, we also verify that unused bits/bytes are zeroed so
14432 * we can use them later without fear of regressing existing binaries.
14433 */
14434 if (bcmp(&dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_MAG0],
14435 DOF_MAG_STRING, DOF_MAG_STRLEN) != 0) {
14436 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF magic string mismatch");
14437 return (-1);
14438 }
14439
14440 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_MODEL] != DOF_MODEL_ILP32 &&
14441 dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_MODEL] != DOF_MODEL_LP64) {
14442 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF has invalid data model");
14443 return (-1);
14444 }
14445
14446 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_ENCODING] != DOF_ENCODE_NATIVE) {
14447 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF encoding mismatch");
14448 return (-1);
14449 }
14450
14451 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_VERSION] != DOF_VERSION_1 &&
14452 dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_VERSION] != DOF_VERSION_2) {
14453 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF version mismatch");
14454 return (-1);
14455 }
14456
14457 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_DIFVERS] != DIF_VERSION_2) {
14458 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF uses unsupported instruction set");
14459 return (-1);
14460 }
14461
14462 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_DIFIREG] > DIF_DIR_NREGS) {
14463 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF uses too many integer registers");
14464 return (-1);
14465 }
14466
14467 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_DIFTREG] > DIF_DTR_NREGS) {
14468 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF uses too many tuple registers");
14469 return (-1);
14470 }
14471
14472 for (i = DOF_ID_PAD; i < DOF_ID_SIZE; i++) {
14473 if (dof->dofh_ident[i] != 0) {
14474 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF has invalid ident byte set");
14475 return (-1);
14476 }
14477 }
14478
14479 if (dof->dofh_flags & ~DOF_FL_VALID) {
14480 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "DOF has invalid flag bits set");
14481 return (-1);
14482 }
14483
14484 if (dof->dofh_secsize == 0) {
14485 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "zero section header size");
14486 return (-1);
14487 }
14488
14489 /*
14490 * Check that the section headers don't exceed the amount of DOF
14491 * data. Note that we cast the section size and number of sections
14492 * to uint64_t's to prevent possible overflow in the multiplication.
14493 */
14494 seclen = (uint64_t)dof->dofh_secnum * (uint64_t)dof->dofh_secsize;
14495
14496 if (dof->dofh_secoff > len || seclen > len ||
14497 dof->dofh_secoff + seclen > len) {
14498 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "truncated section headers");
14499 return (-1);
14500 }
14501
14502 if (!IS_P2ALIGNED(dof->dofh_secoff, sizeof (uint64_t))) {
14503 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned section headers");
14504 return (-1);
14505 }
14506
14507 if (!IS_P2ALIGNED(dof->dofh_secsize, sizeof (uint64_t))) {
14508 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned section size");
14509 return (-1);
14510 }
14511
14512 /*
14513 * Take an initial pass through the section headers to be sure that
14514 * the headers don't have stray offsets. If the 'noprobes' flag is
14515 * set, do not permit sections relating to providers, probes, or args.
14516 */
14517 for (i = 0; i < dof->dofh_secnum; i++) {
14518 dof_sec_t *sec = (dof_sec_t *)(daddr +
14519 (uintptr_t)dof->dofh_secoff + i * dof->dofh_secsize);
14520
14521 if (noprobes) {
14522 switch (sec->dofs_type) {
14523 case DOF_SECT_PROVIDER:
14524 case DOF_SECT_PROBES:
14525 case DOF_SECT_PRARGS:
14526 case DOF_SECT_PROFFS:
14527 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "illegal sections "
14528 "for enabling");
14529 return (-1);
14530 }
14531 }
14532
14533 if (DOF_SEC_ISLOADABLE(sec->dofs_type) &&
14534 !(sec->dofs_flags & DOF_SECF_LOAD)) {
14535 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "loadable section with load "
14536 "flag unset");
14537 return (-1);
14538 }
14539
14540 if (!(sec->dofs_flags & DOF_SECF_LOAD))
14541 continue; /* just ignore non-loadable sections */
14542
14543 if (!ISP2(sec->dofs_align)) {
14544 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad section alignment");
14545 return (-1);
14546 }
14547
14548 if (sec->dofs_offset & (sec->dofs_align - 1)) {
14549 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned section");
14550 return (-1);
14551 }
14552
14553 if (sec->dofs_offset > len || sec->dofs_size > len ||
14554 sec->dofs_offset + sec->dofs_size > len) {
14555 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "corrupt section header");
14556 return (-1);
14557 }
14558
14559 if (sec->dofs_type == DOF_SECT_STRTAB && *((char *)daddr +
14560 sec->dofs_offset + sec->dofs_size - 1) != '\0') {
14561 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "non-terminating string table");
14562 return (-1);
14563 }
14564 }
14565
14566 /*
14567 * Take a second pass through the sections and locate and perform any
14568 * relocations that are present. We do this after the first pass to
14569 * be sure that all sections have had their headers validated.
14570 */
14571 for (i = 0; i < dof->dofh_secnum; i++) {
14572 dof_sec_t *sec = (dof_sec_t *)(daddr +
14573 (uintptr_t)dof->dofh_secoff + i * dof->dofh_secsize);
14574
14575 if (!(sec->dofs_flags & DOF_SECF_LOAD))
14576 continue; /* skip sections that are not loadable */
14577
14578 switch (sec->dofs_type) {
14579 case DOF_SECT_URELHDR:
14580 if (dtrace_dof_relocate(dof, sec, ubase, udaddr) != 0)
14581 return (-1);
14582 break;
14583 }
14584 }
14585
14586 if ((enab = *enabp) == NULL)
14587 enab = *enabp = dtrace_enabling_create(vstate);
14588
14589 for (i = 0; i < dof->dofh_secnum; i++) {
14590 dof_sec_t *sec = (dof_sec_t *)(daddr +
14591 (uintptr_t)dof->dofh_secoff + i * dof->dofh_secsize);
14592
14593 if (sec->dofs_type != DOF_SECT_ECBDESC)
14594 continue;
14595
14596 if ((ep = dtrace_dof_ecbdesc(dof, sec, vstate, cr)) == NULL) {
14597 dtrace_enabling_destroy(enab);
14598 *enabp = NULL;
14599 return (-1);
14600 }
14601
14602 dtrace_enabling_add(enab, ep);
14603 }
14604
14605 return (0);
14606}
14607
14608/*
14609 * Process DOF for any options. This routine assumes that the DOF has been
14610 * at least processed by dtrace_dof_slurp().
14611 */
14612static int
14613dtrace_dof_options(dof_hdr_t *dof, dtrace_state_t *state)
14614{
14615 int i, rval;
14616 uint32_t entsize;
14617 size_t offs;
14618 dof_optdesc_t *desc;
14619
14620 for (i = 0; i < dof->dofh_secnum; i++) {
14621 dof_sec_t *sec = (dof_sec_t *)((uintptr_t)dof +
14622 (uintptr_t)dof->dofh_secoff + i * dof->dofh_secsize);
14623
14624 if (sec->dofs_type != DOF_SECT_OPTDESC)
14625 continue;
14626
14627 if (sec->dofs_align != sizeof (uint64_t)) {
14628 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad alignment in "
14629 "option description");
14630 return (EINVAL);
14631 }
14632
14633 if ((entsize = sec->dofs_entsize) == 0) {
14634 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "zeroed option entry size");
14635 return (EINVAL);
14636 }
14637
14638 if (entsize < sizeof (dof_optdesc_t)) {
14639 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad option entry size");
14640 return (EINVAL);
14641 }
14642
14643 for (offs = 0; offs < sec->dofs_size; offs += entsize) {
14644 desc = (dof_optdesc_t *)((uintptr_t)dof +
14645 (uintptr_t)sec->dofs_offset + offs);
14646
14647 if (desc->dofo_strtab != DOF_SECIDX_NONE) {
14648 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "non-zero option string");
14649 return (EINVAL);
14650 }
14651
14652 if (desc->dofo_value == DTRACEOPT_UNSET) {
14653 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "unset option");
14654 return (EINVAL);
14655 }
14656
14657 if ((rval = dtrace_state_option(state,
14658 desc->dofo_option, desc->dofo_value)) != 0) {
14659 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "rejected option");
14660 return (rval);
14661 }
14662 }
14663 }
14664
14665 return (0);
14666}
14667
14668/*
14669 * DTrace Consumer State Functions
14670 */
14671static int
14672dtrace_dstate_init(dtrace_dstate_t *dstate, size_t size)
14673{
14674 size_t hashsize, maxper, min, chunksize = dstate->dtds_chunksize;
14675 void *base;
14676 uintptr_t limit;
14677 dtrace_dynvar_t *dvar, *next, *start;
14678 int i;
14679
14680 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
14681 ASSERT(dstate->dtds_base == NULL && dstate->dtds_percpu == NULL);
14682
14683 bzero(dstate, sizeof (dtrace_dstate_t));
14684
14685 if ((dstate->dtds_chunksize = chunksize) == 0)
14686 dstate->dtds_chunksize = DTRACE_DYNVAR_CHUNKSIZE;
14687
14688 VERIFY(dstate->dtds_chunksize < LONG_MAX);
14689
14690 if (size < (min = dstate->dtds_chunksize + sizeof (dtrace_dynhash_t)))
14691 size = min;
14692
14693 if ((base = kmem_zalloc(size, KM_NOSLEEP | KM_NORMALPRI)) == NULL)
14694 return (ENOMEM);
14695
14696 dstate->dtds_size = size;
14697 dstate->dtds_base = base;
14698 dstate->dtds_percpu = kmem_cache_alloc(dtrace_state_cache, KM_SLEEP);
14699 bzero(dstate->dtds_percpu, NCPU * sizeof (dtrace_dstate_percpu_t));
14700
14701 hashsize = size / (dstate->dtds_chunksize + sizeof (dtrace_dynhash_t));
14702
14703 if (hashsize != 1 && (hashsize & 1))
14704 hashsize--;
14705
14706 dstate->dtds_hashsize = hashsize;
14707 dstate->dtds_hash = dstate->dtds_base;
14708
14709 /*
14710 * Set all of our hash buckets to point to the single sink, and (if
14711 * it hasn't already been set), set the sink's hash value to be the
14712 * sink sentinel value. The sink is needed for dynamic variable
14713 * lookups to know that they have iterated over an entire, valid hash
14714 * chain.
14715 */
14716 for (i = 0; i < hashsize; i++)
14717 dstate->dtds_hash[i].dtdh_chain = &dtrace_dynhash_sink;
14718
14719 if (dtrace_dynhash_sink.dtdv_hashval != DTRACE_DYNHASH_SINK)
14720 dtrace_dynhash_sink.dtdv_hashval = DTRACE_DYNHASH_SINK;
14721
14722 /*
14723 * Determine number of active CPUs. Divide free list evenly among
14724 * active CPUs.
14725 */
14726 start = (dtrace_dynvar_t *)
14727 ((uintptr_t)base + hashsize * sizeof (dtrace_dynhash_t));
14728 limit = (uintptr_t)base + size;
14729
14730 VERIFY((uintptr_t)start < limit);
14731 VERIFY((uintptr_t)start >= (uintptr_t)base);
14732
14733 maxper = (limit - (uintptr_t)start) / NCPU;
14734 maxper = (maxper / dstate->dtds_chunksize) * dstate->dtds_chunksize;
14735
14736#ifdef illumos
14737 for (i = 0; i < NCPU; i++)
14738#endif
14739#ifdef __FreeBSD__
14740 CPU_FOREACH(i)
14741#endif
14742#ifdef __NetBSD__
14743 for (i = 0; i < NCPU; i++)
14744#endif
14745 {
14746 dstate->dtds_percpu[i].dtdsc_free = dvar = start;
14747
14748 /*
14749 * If we don't even have enough chunks to make it once through
14750 * NCPUs, we're just going to allocate everything to the first
14751 * CPU. And if we're on the last CPU, we're going to allocate
14752 * whatever is left over. In either case, we set the limit to
14753 * be the limit of the dynamic variable space.
14754 */
14755 if (maxper == 0 || i == NCPU - 1) {
14756 limit = (uintptr_t)base + size;
14757 start = NULL;
14758 } else {
14759 limit = (uintptr_t)start + maxper;
14760 start = (dtrace_dynvar_t *)limit;
14761 }
14762
14763 VERIFY(limit <= (uintptr_t)base + size);
14764
14765 for (;;) {
14766 next = (dtrace_dynvar_t *)((uintptr_t)dvar +
14767 dstate->dtds_chunksize);
14768
14769 if ((uintptr_t)next + dstate->dtds_chunksize >= limit)
14770 break;
14771
14772 VERIFY((uintptr_t)dvar >= (uintptr_t)base &&
14773 (uintptr_t)dvar <= (uintptr_t)base + size);
14774 dvar->dtdv_next = next;
14775 dvar = next;
14776 }
14777
14778 if (maxper == 0)
14779 break;
14780 }
14781
14782 return (0);
14783}
14784
14785static void
14786dtrace_dstate_fini(dtrace_dstate_t *dstate)
14787{
14788 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
14789
14790 if (dstate->dtds_base == NULL)
14791 return;
14792
14793 kmem_free(dstate->dtds_base, dstate->dtds_size);
14794 kmem_cache_free(dtrace_state_cache, dstate->dtds_percpu);
14795}
14796
14797static void
14798dtrace_vstate_fini(dtrace_vstate_t *vstate)
14799{
14800 /*
14801 * Logical XOR, where are you?
14802 */
14803 ASSERT((vstate->dtvs_nglobals == 0) ^ (vstate->dtvs_globals != NULL));
14804
14805 if (vstate->dtvs_nglobals > 0) {
14806 kmem_free(vstate->dtvs_globals, vstate->dtvs_nglobals *
14807 sizeof (dtrace_statvar_t *));
14808 }
14809
14810 if (vstate->dtvs_ntlocals > 0) {
14811 kmem_free(vstate->dtvs_tlocals, vstate->dtvs_ntlocals *
14812 sizeof (dtrace_difv_t));
14813 }
14814
14815 ASSERT((vstate->dtvs_nlocals == 0) ^ (vstate->dtvs_locals != NULL));
14816
14817 if (vstate->dtvs_nlocals > 0) {
14818 kmem_free(vstate->dtvs_locals, vstate->dtvs_nlocals *
14819 sizeof (dtrace_statvar_t *));
14820 }
14821}
14822
14823#ifdef __FreeBSD__
14824static void
14825dtrace_state_clean(void *arg)
14826{
14827 dtrace_state_t *state = arg;
14828 dtrace_optval_t *opt = state->dts_options;
14829
14830 if (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE)
14831 return;
14832
14833 dtrace_dynvar_clean(&state->dts_vstate.dtvs_dynvars);
14834 dtrace_speculation_clean(state);
14835
14836 callout_reset(&state->dts_cleaner, hz * opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] / NANOSEC,
14837 dtrace_state_clean, state);
14838}
14839
14840static void
14841dtrace_state_deadman(void *arg)
14842{
14843 dtrace_state_t *state = arg;
14844 hrtime_t now;
14845
14846 dtrace_sync();
14847
14848 dtrace_debug_output();
14849
14850 now = dtrace_gethrtime();
14851
14852 if (state != dtrace_anon.dta_state &&
14853 now - state->dts_laststatus >= dtrace_deadman_user)
14854 return;
14855
14856 /*
14857 * We must be sure that dts_alive never appears to be less than the
14858 * value upon entry to dtrace_state_deadman(), and because we lack a
14859 * dtrace_cas64(), we cannot store to it atomically. We thus instead
14860 * store INT64_MAX to it, followed by a memory barrier, followed by
14861 * the new value. This assures that dts_alive never appears to be
14862 * less than its true value, regardless of the order in which the
14863 * stores to the underlying storage are issued.
14864 */
14865 state->dts_alive = INT64_MAX;
14866 dtrace_membar_producer();
14867 state->dts_alive = now;
14868
14869 callout_reset(&state->dts_deadman, hz * dtrace_deadman_interval / NANOSEC,
14870 dtrace_state_deadman, state);
14871}
14872#else
14873static void
14874dtrace_state_clean(dtrace_state_t *state)
14875{
14876 if (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE)
14877 return;
14878
14879 dtrace_dynvar_clean(&state->dts_vstate.dtvs_dynvars);
14880 dtrace_speculation_clean(state);
14881}
14882
14883static void
14884dtrace_state_deadman(dtrace_state_t *state)
14885{
14886 hrtime_t now;
14887
14888 dtrace_sync();
14889
14890 now = dtrace_gethrtime();
14891
14892 if (state != dtrace_anon.dta_state &&
14893 now - state->dts_laststatus >= dtrace_deadman_user)
14894 return;
14895
14896 /*
14897 * We must be sure that dts_alive never appears to be less than the
14898 * value upon entry to dtrace_state_deadman(), and because we lack a
14899 * dtrace_cas64(), we cannot store to it atomically. We thus instead
14900 * store INT64_MAX to it, followed by a memory barrier, followed by
14901 * the new value. This assures that dts_alive never appears to be
14902 * less than its true value, regardless of the order in which the
14903 * stores to the underlying storage are issued.
14904 */
14905 state->dts_alive = INT64_MAX;
14906 dtrace_membar_producer();
14907 state->dts_alive = now;
14908}
14909
14910#endif /* illumos */
14911
14912static dtrace_state_t *
14913#ifdef illumos
14914dtrace_state_create(dev_t *devp, cred_t *cr)
14915#endif
14916#ifdef __FreeBSD__
14917dtrace_state_create(struct cdev *dev, struct ucred *cred __unused)
14918#endif
14919#ifdef __NetBSD__
14920dtrace_state_create(dev_t *devp, cred_t *cr)
14921#endif
14922{
14923#ifdef illumos
14924 minor_t minor;
14925 major_t major;
14926#else
14927 int m = 0;
14928#endif
14929#ifdef __FreeBSD__
14930 cred_t *cr = NULL;
14931#endif
14932 int cpu_it;
14933 char c[30];
14934 dtrace_state_t *state;
14935 dtrace_optval_t *opt;
14936 int bufsize = NCPU * sizeof (dtrace_buffer_t), i;
14937
14938 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
14939 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
14940
14941#ifdef illumos
14942 minor = (minor_t)(uintptr_t)vmem_alloc(dtrace_minor, 1,
14943 VM_BESTFIT | VM_SLEEP);
14944
14945 if (ddi_soft_state_zalloc(dtrace_softstate, minor) != DDI_SUCCESS) {
14946 vmem_free(dtrace_minor, (void *)(uintptr_t)minor, 1);
14947 return (NULL);
14948 }
14949
14950 state = ddi_get_soft_state(dtrace_softstate, minor);
14951#endif
14952#ifdef __FreeBSD__
14953 if (dev != NULL) {
14954 cr = dev->si_cred;
14955 m = dev2unit(dev);
14956 }
14957#endif
14958#ifdef __NetBSD__
14959 m = minor(*devp) & 0x0F;
14960
14961 /* Allocate memory for the state. */
14962 state = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(dtrace_state_t), KM_SLEEP);
14963#endif
14964
14965
14966 state->dts_epid = DTRACE_EPIDNONE + 1;
14967
14968 (void) snprintf(c, sizeof (c), "dtrace_aggid_%d", m);
14969#ifdef illumos
14970 state->dts_aggid_arena = vmem_create(c, (void *)1, UINT32_MAX, 1,
14971 NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, VM_SLEEP | VMC_IDENTIFIER);
14972
14973 if (devp != NULL) {
14974 major = getemajor(*devp);
14975 } else {
14976 major = ddi_driver_major(dtrace_devi);
14977 }
14978
14979 state->dts_dev = makedevice(major, minor);
14980
14981 if (devp != NULL)
14982 *devp = state->dts_dev;
14983#endif
14984#ifdef __FreeBSD__
14985 state->dts_aggid_arena = new_unrhdr(1, INT_MAX, &dtrace_unr_mtx);
14986 state->dts_dev = dev;
14987#endif
14988#ifdef __NetBSD__
14989 state->dts_aggid_arena = vmem_create(c, 1, INT_MAX, 1,
14990 NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, VM_SLEEP, IPL_NONE);
14991 state->dts_dev = *devp;
14992#endif
14993
14994 /*
14995 * We allocate NCPU buffers. On the one hand, this can be quite
14996 * a bit of memory per instance (nearly 36K on a Starcat). On the
14997 * other hand, it saves an additional memory reference in the probe
14998 * path.
14999 */
15000 state->dts_buffer = kmem_zalloc(bufsize, KM_SLEEP);
15001 state->dts_aggbuffer = kmem_zalloc(bufsize, KM_SLEEP);
15002
15003 /*
15004 * Allocate and initialise the per-process per-CPU random state.
15005 * SI_SUB_RANDOM < SI_SUB_DTRACE_ANON therefore entropy device is
15006 * assumed to be seeded at this point (if from Fortuna seed file).
15007 */
15008 (void) read_random(&state->dts_rstate[0], 2 * sizeof(uint64_t));
15009 for (cpu_it = 1; cpu_it < NCPU; cpu_it++) {
15010 /*
15011 * Each CPU is assigned a 2^64 period, non-overlapping
15012 * subsequence.
15013 */
15014 dtrace_xoroshiro128_plus_jump(state->dts_rstate[cpu_it-1],
15015 state->dts_rstate[cpu_it]);
15016 }
15017
15018
15019#ifdef illumos
15020 state->dts_cleaner = CYCLIC_NONE;
15021 state->dts_deadman = CYCLIC_NONE;
15022#endif
15023#ifdef __FreeBSD__
15024 callout_init(&state->dts_cleaner, 1);
15025 callout_init(&state->dts_deadman, 1);
15026#endif
15027#ifdef __NetBSD__
15028 state->dts_cleaner = NULL;
15029 state->dts_deadman = NULL;
15030#endif
15031 state->dts_vstate.dtvs_state = state;
15032
15033 for (i = 0; i < DTRACEOPT_MAX; i++)
15034 state->dts_options[i] = DTRACEOPT_UNSET;
15035
15036 /*
15037 * Set the default options.
15038 */
15039 opt = state->dts_options;
15040 opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY] = DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY_SWITCH;
15041 opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE] = DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE_AUTO;
15042 opt[DTRACEOPT_NSPEC] = dtrace_nspec_default;
15043 opt[DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE] = dtrace_specsize_default;
15044 opt[DTRACEOPT_CPU] = (dtrace_optval_t)DTRACE_CPUALL;
15045 opt[DTRACEOPT_STRSIZE] = dtrace_strsize_default;
15046 opt[DTRACEOPT_STACKFRAMES] = dtrace_stackframes_default;
15047 opt[DTRACEOPT_USTACKFRAMES] = dtrace_ustackframes_default;
15048 opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] = dtrace_cleanrate_default;
15049 opt[DTRACEOPT_AGGRATE] = dtrace_aggrate_default;
15050 opt[DTRACEOPT_SWITCHRATE] = dtrace_switchrate_default;
15051 opt[DTRACEOPT_STATUSRATE] = dtrace_statusrate_default;
15052 opt[DTRACEOPT_JSTACKFRAMES] = dtrace_jstackframes_default;
15053 opt[DTRACEOPT_JSTACKSTRSIZE] = dtrace_jstackstrsize_default;
15054
15055 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE;
15056
15057 /*
15058 * Depending on the user credentials, we set flag bits which alter probe
15059 * visibility or the amount of destructiveness allowed. In the case of
15060 * actual anonymous tracing, or the possession of all privileges, all of
15061 * the normal checks are bypassed.
15062 */
15063 if (cr == NULL || PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_ALL, B_FALSE)) {
15064 state->dts_cred.dcr_visible = DTRACE_CRV_ALL;
15065 state->dts_cred.dcr_action = DTRACE_CRA_ALL;
15066 } else {
15067 /*
15068 * Set up the credentials for this instantiation. We take a
15069 * hold on the credential to prevent it from disappearing on
15070 * us; this in turn prevents the zone_t referenced by this
15071 * credential from disappearing. This means that we can
15072 * examine the credential and the zone from probe context.
15073 */
15074 crhold(cr);
15075 state->dts_cred.dcr_cred = cr;
15076
15077 /*
15078 * CRA_PROC means "we have *some* privilege for dtrace" and
15079 * unlocks the use of variables like pid, zonename, etc.
15080 */
15081 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_DTRACE_USER, B_FALSE) ||
15082 PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_DTRACE_PROC, B_FALSE)) {
15083 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |= DTRACE_CRA_PROC;
15084 }
15085
15086 /*
15087 * dtrace_user allows use of syscall and profile providers.
15088 * If the user also has proc_owner and/or proc_zone, we
15089 * extend the scope to include additional visibility and
15090 * destructive power.
15091 */
15092 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_DTRACE_USER, B_FALSE)) {
15093 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_PROC_OWNER, B_FALSE)) {
15094 state->dts_cred.dcr_visible |=
15095 DTRACE_CRV_ALLPROC;
15096
15097 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15098 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_ALLUSER;
15099 }
15100
15101 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_PROC_ZONE, B_FALSE)) {
15102 state->dts_cred.dcr_visible |=
15103 DTRACE_CRV_ALLZONE;
15104
15105 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15106 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_ALLZONE;
15107 }
15108
15109 /*
15110 * If we have all privs in whatever zone this is,
15111 * we can do destructive things to processes which
15112 * have altered credentials.
15113 */
15114#ifdef illumos
15115 if (priv_isequalset(priv_getset(cr, PRIV_EFFECTIVE),
15116 cr->cr_zone->zone_privset)) {
15117 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15118 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_CREDCHG;
15119 }
15120#endif
15121 }
15122
15123 /*
15124 * Holding the dtrace_kernel privilege also implies that
15125 * the user has the dtrace_user privilege from a visibility
15126 * perspective. But without further privileges, some
15127 * destructive actions are not available.
15128 */
15129 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_DTRACE_KERNEL, B_FALSE)) {
15130 /*
15131 * Make all probes in all zones visible. However,
15132 * this doesn't mean that all actions become available
15133 * to all zones.
15134 */
15135 state->dts_cred.dcr_visible |= DTRACE_CRV_KERNEL |
15136 DTRACE_CRV_ALLPROC | DTRACE_CRV_ALLZONE;
15137
15138 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |= DTRACE_CRA_KERNEL |
15139 DTRACE_CRA_PROC;
15140 /*
15141 * Holding proc_owner means that destructive actions
15142 * for *this* zone are allowed.
15143 */
15144 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_PROC_OWNER, B_FALSE))
15145 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15146 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_ALLUSER;
15147
15148 /*
15149 * Holding proc_zone means that destructive actions
15150 * for this user/group ID in all zones is allowed.
15151 */
15152 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_PROC_ZONE, B_FALSE))
15153 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15154 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_ALLZONE;
15155
15156#ifdef illumos
15157 /*
15158 * If we have all privs in whatever zone this is,
15159 * we can do destructive things to processes which
15160 * have altered credentials.
15161 */
15162 if (priv_isequalset(priv_getset(cr, PRIV_EFFECTIVE),
15163 cr->cr_zone->zone_privset)) {
15164 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15165 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_CREDCHG;
15166 }
15167#endif
15168 }
15169
15170 /*
15171 * Holding the dtrace_proc privilege gives control over fasttrap
15172 * and pid providers. We need to grant wider destructive
15173 * privileges in the event that the user has proc_owner and/or
15174 * proc_zone.
15175 */
15176 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_DTRACE_PROC, B_FALSE)) {
15177 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_PROC_OWNER, B_FALSE))
15178 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15179 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_ALLUSER;
15180
15181 if (PRIV_POLICY_ONLY(cr, PRIV_PROC_ZONE, B_FALSE))
15182 state->dts_cred.dcr_action |=
15183 DTRACE_CRA_PROC_DESTRUCTIVE_ALLZONE;
15184 }
15185 }
15186
15187 return (state);
15188}
15189
15190static int
15191dtrace_state_buffer(dtrace_state_t *state, dtrace_buffer_t *buf, int which)
15192{
15193 dtrace_optval_t *opt = state->dts_options, size;
15194 processorid_t cpu = 0;;
15195 int flags = 0, rval, factor, divisor = 1;
15196
15197 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
15198 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
15199 ASSERT(which < DTRACEOPT_MAX);
15200 ASSERT(state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE ||
15201 (state == dtrace_anon.dta_state &&
15202 state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE));
15203
15204 if (opt[which] == DTRACEOPT_UNSET || opt[which] == 0)
15205 return (0);
15206
15207 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_CPU] != DTRACEOPT_UNSET)
15208 cpu = opt[DTRACEOPT_CPU];
15209
15210 if (which == DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE)
15211 flags |= DTRACEBUF_NOSWITCH;
15212
15213 if (which == DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE) {
15214 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY] == DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY_RING)
15215 flags |= DTRACEBUF_RING;
15216
15217 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY] == DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY_FILL)
15218 flags |= DTRACEBUF_FILL;
15219
15220 if (state != dtrace_anon.dta_state ||
15221 state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE)
15222 flags |= DTRACEBUF_INACTIVE;
15223 }
15224
15225 for (size = opt[which]; size >= sizeof (uint64_t); size /= divisor) {
15226 /*
15227 * The size must be 8-byte aligned. If the size is not 8-byte
15228 * aligned, drop it down by the difference.
15229 */
15230 if (size & (sizeof (uint64_t) - 1))
15231 size -= size & (sizeof (uint64_t) - 1);
15232
15233 if (size < state->dts_reserve) {
15234 /*
15235 * Buffers always must be large enough to accommodate
15236 * their prereserved space. We return E2BIG instead
15237 * of ENOMEM in this case to allow for user-level
15238 * software to differentiate the cases.
15239 */
15240 return (E2BIG);
15241 }
15242
15243 rval = dtrace_buffer_alloc(buf, size, flags, cpu, &factor);
15244
15245 if (rval != ENOMEM) {
15246 opt[which] = size;
15247 return (rval);
15248 }
15249
15250 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE] == DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE_MANUAL)
15251 return (rval);
15252
15253 for (divisor = 2; divisor < factor; divisor <<= 1)
15254 continue;
15255 }
15256
15257 return (ENOMEM);
15258}
15259
15260static int
15261dtrace_state_buffers(dtrace_state_t *state)
15262{
15263 dtrace_speculation_t *spec = state->dts_speculations;
15264 int rval, i;
15265
15266 if ((rval = dtrace_state_buffer(state, state->dts_buffer,
15267 DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE)) != 0)
15268 return (rval);
15269
15270 if ((rval = dtrace_state_buffer(state, state->dts_aggbuffer,
15271 DTRACEOPT_AGGSIZE)) != 0)
15272 return (rval);
15273
15274 for (i = 0; i < state->dts_nspeculations; i++) {
15275 if ((rval = dtrace_state_buffer(state,
15276 spec[i].dtsp_buffer, DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE)) != 0)
15277 return (rval);
15278 }
15279
15280 return (0);
15281}
15282
15283static void
15284dtrace_state_prereserve(dtrace_state_t *state)
15285{
15286 dtrace_ecb_t *ecb;
15287 dtrace_probe_t *probe;
15288
15289 state->dts_reserve = 0;
15290
15291 if (state->dts_options[DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY] != DTRACEOPT_BUFPOLICY_FILL)
15292 return;
15293
15294 /*
15295 * If our buffer policy is a "fill" buffer policy, we need to set the
15296 * prereserved space to be the space required by the END probes.
15297 */
15298 probe = dtrace_probes[dtrace_probeid_end - 1];
15299 ASSERT(probe != NULL);
15300
15301 for (ecb = probe->dtpr_ecb; ecb != NULL; ecb = ecb->dte_next) {
15302 if (ecb->dte_state != state)
15303 continue;
15304
15305 state->dts_reserve += ecb->dte_needed + ecb->dte_alignment;
15306 }
15307}
15308
15309static int
15310dtrace_state_go(dtrace_state_t *state, processorid_t *cpu)
15311{
15312 dtrace_optval_t *opt = state->dts_options, sz, nspec;
15313 dtrace_speculation_t *spec;
15314 dtrace_buffer_t *buf;
15315#ifdef illumos
15316 cyc_handler_t hdlr;
15317 cyc_time_t when;
15318#endif
15319 int rval = 0, i, bufsize = NCPU * sizeof (dtrace_buffer_t);
15320 dtrace_icookie_t cookie;
15321
15322 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
15323 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
15324
15325 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE) {
15326 rval = EBUSY;
15327 goto out;
15328 }
15329
15330 /*
15331 * Before we can perform any checks, we must prime all of the
15332 * retained enablings that correspond to this state.
15333 */
15334 dtrace_enabling_prime(state);
15335
15336 if (state->dts_destructive && !state->dts_cred.dcr_destructive) {
15337 rval = EACCES;
15338 goto out;
15339 }
15340
15341 dtrace_state_prereserve(state);
15342
15343 /*
15344 * Now we want to do is try to allocate our speculations.
15345 * We do not automatically resize the number of speculations; if
15346 * this fails, we will fail the operation.
15347 */
15348 nspec = opt[DTRACEOPT_NSPEC];
15349 ASSERT(nspec != DTRACEOPT_UNSET);
15350
15351 if (nspec > INT_MAX) {
15352 rval = ENOMEM;
15353 goto out;
15354 }
15355
15356 spec = kmem_zalloc(nspec * sizeof (dtrace_speculation_t),
15357 KM_NOSLEEP | KM_NORMALPRI);
15358
15359 if (spec == NULL) {
15360 rval = ENOMEM;
15361 goto out;
15362 }
15363
15364 state->dts_speculations = spec;
15365 state->dts_nspeculations = (int)nspec;
15366
15367 for (i = 0; i < nspec; i++) {
15368 if ((buf = kmem_zalloc(bufsize,
15369 KM_NOSLEEP | KM_NORMALPRI)) == NULL) {
15370 rval = ENOMEM;
15371 goto err;
15372 }
15373
15374 spec[i].dtsp_buffer = buf;
15375 }
15376
15377 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_GRABANON] != DTRACEOPT_UNSET) {
15378 if (dtrace_anon.dta_state == NULL) {
15379 rval = ENOENT;
15380 goto out;
15381 }
15382
15383 if (state->dts_necbs != 0) {
15384 rval = EALREADY;
15385 goto out;
15386 }
15387
15388 state->dts_anon = dtrace_anon_grab();
15389 ASSERT(state->dts_anon != NULL);
15390 state = state->dts_anon;
15391
15392 /*
15393 * We want "grabanon" to be set in the grabbed state, so we'll
15394 * copy that option value from the grabbing state into the
15395 * grabbed state.
15396 */
15397 state->dts_options[DTRACEOPT_GRABANON] =
15398 opt[DTRACEOPT_GRABANON];
15399
15400 *cpu = dtrace_anon.dta_beganon;
15401
15402 /*
15403 * If the anonymous state is active (as it almost certainly
15404 * is if the anonymous enabling ultimately matched anything),
15405 * we don't allow any further option processing -- but we
15406 * don't return failure.
15407 */
15408 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE)
15409 goto out;
15410 }
15411
15412 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_AGGSIZE] != DTRACEOPT_UNSET &&
15413 opt[DTRACEOPT_AGGSIZE] != 0) {
15414 if (state->dts_aggregations == NULL) {
15415 /*
15416 * We're not going to create an aggregation buffer
15417 * because we don't have any ECBs that contain
15418 * aggregations -- set this option to 0.
15419 */
15420 opt[DTRACEOPT_AGGSIZE] = 0;
15421 } else {
15422 /*
15423 * If we have an aggregation buffer, we must also have
15424 * a buffer to use as scratch.
15425 */
15426 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE] == DTRACEOPT_UNSET ||
15427 opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE] < state->dts_needed) {
15428 opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE] = state->dts_needed;
15429 }
15430 }
15431 }
15432
15433 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE] != DTRACEOPT_UNSET &&
15434 opt[DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE] != 0) {
15435 if (!state->dts_speculates) {
15436 /*
15437 * We're not going to create speculation buffers
15438 * because we don't have any ECBs that actually
15439 * speculate -- set the speculation size to 0.
15440 */
15441 opt[DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE] = 0;
15442 }
15443 }
15444
15445 /*
15446 * The bare minimum size for any buffer that we're actually going to
15447 * do anything to is sizeof (uint64_t).
15448 */
15449 sz = sizeof (uint64_t);
15450
15451 if ((state->dts_needed != 0 && opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE] < sz) ||
15452 (state->dts_speculates && opt[DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE] < sz) ||
15453 (state->dts_aggregations != NULL && opt[DTRACEOPT_AGGSIZE] < sz)) {
15454 /*
15455 * A buffer size has been explicitly set to 0 (or to a size
15456 * that will be adjusted to 0) and we need the space -- we
15457 * need to return failure. We return ENOSPC to differentiate
15458 * it from failing to allocate a buffer due to failure to meet
15459 * the reserve (for which we return E2BIG).
15460 */
15461 rval = ENOSPC;
15462 goto out;
15463 }
15464
15465 if ((rval = dtrace_state_buffers(state)) != 0)
15466 goto err;
15467
15468 if ((sz = opt[DTRACEOPT_DYNVARSIZE]) == DTRACEOPT_UNSET)
15469 sz = dtrace_dstate_defsize;
15470
15471 do {
15472 rval = dtrace_dstate_init(&state->dts_vstate.dtvs_dynvars, sz);
15473
15474 if (rval == 0)
15475 break;
15476
15477 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE] == DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE_MANUAL)
15478 goto err;
15479 } while (sz >>= 1);
15480
15481 opt[DTRACEOPT_DYNVARSIZE] = sz;
15482
15483 if (rval != 0)
15484 goto err;
15485
15486 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_STATUSRATE] > dtrace_statusrate_max)
15487 opt[DTRACEOPT_STATUSRATE] = dtrace_statusrate_max;
15488
15489 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] == 0)
15490 opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] = dtrace_cleanrate_max;
15491
15492 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] < dtrace_cleanrate_min)
15493 opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] = dtrace_cleanrate_min;
15494
15495 if (opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] > dtrace_cleanrate_max)
15496 opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] = dtrace_cleanrate_max;
15497
15498 state->dts_alive = state->dts_laststatus = dtrace_gethrtime();
15499#ifdef illumos
15500 hdlr.cyh_func = (cyc_func_t)dtrace_state_clean;
15501 hdlr.cyh_arg = state;
15502 hdlr.cyh_level = CY_LOW_LEVEL;
15503
15504 when.cyt_when = 0;
15505 when.cyt_interval = opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE];
15506
15507 state->dts_cleaner = cyclic_add(&hdlr, &when);
15508
15509 hdlr.cyh_func = (cyc_func_t)dtrace_state_deadman;
15510 hdlr.cyh_arg = state;
15511 hdlr.cyh_level = CY_LOW_LEVEL;
15512
15513 when.cyt_when = 0;
15514 when.cyt_interval = dtrace_deadman_interval;
15515
15516 state->dts_deadman = cyclic_add(&hdlr, &when);
15517#endif
15518#ifdef __FreeBSD__
15519 callout_reset(&state->dts_cleaner, hz * opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE] / NANOSEC,
15520 dtrace_state_clean, state);
15521 callout_reset(&state->dts_deadman, hz * dtrace_deadman_interval / NANOSEC,
15522 dtrace_state_deadman, state);
15523#endif
15524#ifdef __NetBSD__
15525 state->dts_cleaner = dtrace_state_worker_add(
15526 dtrace_state_clean, state, opt[DTRACEOPT_CLEANRATE]);
15527 state->dts_deadman = dtrace_state_worker_add(
15528 dtrace_state_deadman, state, dtrace_deadman_interval);
15529#endif
15530
15531 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_WARMUP;
15532
15533#ifdef illumos
15534 if (state->dts_getf != 0 &&
15535 !(state->dts_cred.dcr_visible & DTRACE_CRV_KERNEL)) {
15536 /*
15537 * We don't have kernel privs but we have at least one call
15538 * to getf(); we need to bump our zone's count, and (if
15539 * this is the first enabling to have an unprivileged call
15540 * to getf()) we need to hook into closef().
15541 */
15542 state->dts_cred.dcr_cred->cr_zone->zone_dtrace_getf++;
15543
15544 if (dtrace_getf++ == 0) {
15545 ASSERT(dtrace_closef == NULL);
15546 dtrace_closef = dtrace_getf_barrier;
15547 }
15548 }
15549#endif
15550
15551 /*
15552 * Now it's time to actually fire the BEGIN probe. We need to disable
15553 * interrupts here both to record the CPU on which we fired the BEGIN
15554 * probe (the data from this CPU will be processed first at user
15555 * level) and to manually activate the buffer for this CPU.
15556 */
15557 cookie = dtrace_interrupt_disable();
15558 *cpu = curcpu_id;
15559 ASSERT(state->dts_buffer[*cpu].dtb_flags & DTRACEBUF_INACTIVE);
15560 state->dts_buffer[*cpu].dtb_flags &= ~DTRACEBUF_INACTIVE;
15561
15562 dtrace_probe(dtrace_probeid_begin,
15563 (uint64_t)(uintptr_t)state, 0, 0, 0, 0);
15564 dtrace_interrupt_enable(cookie);
15565 /*
15566 * We may have had an exit action from a BEGIN probe; only change our
15567 * state to ACTIVE if we're still in WARMUP.
15568 */
15569 ASSERT(state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_WARMUP ||
15570 state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_DRAINING);
15571
15572 if (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_WARMUP)
15573 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE;
15574
15575#ifdef __FreeBSD__
15576 /*
15577 * We enable anonymous tracing before APs are started, so we must
15578 * activate buffers using the current CPU.
15579 */
15580 if (state == dtrace_anon.dta_state)
15581 for (int i = 0; i < NCPU; i++)
15582 dtrace_buffer_activate_cpu(state, i);
15583 else
15584 dtrace_xcall(DTRACE_CPUALL,
15585 (dtrace_xcall_t)dtrace_buffer_activate, state);
15586#else
15587
15588 /*
15589 * Regardless of whether or not now we're in ACTIVE or DRAINING, we
15590 * want each CPU to transition its principal buffer out of the
15591 * INACTIVE state. Doing this assures that no CPU will suddenly begin
15592 * processing an ECB halfway down a probe's ECB chain; all CPUs will
15593 * atomically transition from processing none of a state's ECBs to
15594 * processing all of them.
15595 */
15596 dtrace_xcall(DTRACE_CPUALL,
15597 (dtrace_xcall_t)dtrace_buffer_activate, state);
15598#endif
15599 goto out;
15600
15601err:
15602 dtrace_buffer_free(state->dts_buffer);
15603 dtrace_buffer_free(state->dts_aggbuffer);
15604
15605 if ((nspec = state->dts_nspeculations) == 0) {
15606 ASSERT(state->dts_speculations == NULL);
15607 goto out;
15608 }
15609
15610 spec = state->dts_speculations;
15611 ASSERT(spec != NULL);
15612
15613 for (i = 0; i < state->dts_nspeculations; i++) {
15614 if ((buf = spec[i].dtsp_buffer) == NULL)
15615 break;
15616
15617 dtrace_buffer_free(buf);
15618 kmem_free(buf, bufsize);
15619 }
15620
15621 kmem_free(spec, nspec * sizeof (dtrace_speculation_t));
15622 state->dts_nspeculations = 0;
15623 state->dts_speculations = NULL;
15624
15625out:
15626 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
15627 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
15628
15629 return (rval);
15630}
15631
15632static int
15633dtrace_state_stop(dtrace_state_t *state, processorid_t *cpu)
15634{
15635 dtrace_icookie_t cookie;
15636
15637 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
15638
15639 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE &&
15640 state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_DRAINING)
15641 return (EINVAL);
15642
15643 /*
15644 * We'll set the activity to DTRACE_ACTIVITY_DRAINING, and issue a sync
15645 * to be sure that every CPU has seen it. See below for the details
15646 * on why this is done.
15647 */
15648 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_DRAINING;
15649 dtrace_sync();
15650
15651 /*
15652 * By this point, it is impossible for any CPU to be still processing
15653 * with DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE. We can thus set our activity to
15654 * DTRACE_ACTIVITY_COOLDOWN and know that we're not racing with any
15655 * other CPU in dtrace_buffer_reserve(). This allows dtrace_probe()
15656 * and callees to know that the activity is DTRACE_ACTIVITY_COOLDOWN
15657 * iff we're in the END probe.
15658 */
15659 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_COOLDOWN;
15660 dtrace_sync();
15661 ASSERT(state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_COOLDOWN);
15662
15663 /*
15664 * Finally, we can release the reserve and call the END probe. We
15665 * disable interrupts across calling the END probe to allow us to
15666 * return the CPU on which we actually called the END probe. This
15667 * allows user-land to be sure that this CPU's principal buffer is
15668 * processed last.
15669 */
15670 state->dts_reserve = 0;
15671
15672 cookie = dtrace_interrupt_disable();
15673 *cpu = curcpu_id;
15674 dtrace_probe(dtrace_probeid_end,
15675 (uint64_t)(uintptr_t)state, 0, 0, 0, 0);
15676 dtrace_interrupt_enable(cookie);
15677
15678 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_STOPPED;
15679 dtrace_sync();
15680
15681#ifdef illumos
15682 if (state->dts_getf != 0 &&
15683 !(state->dts_cred.dcr_visible & DTRACE_CRV_KERNEL)) {
15684 /*
15685 * We don't have kernel privs but we have at least one call
15686 * to getf(); we need to lower our zone's count, and (if
15687 * this is the last enabling to have an unprivileged call
15688 * to getf()) we need to clear the closef() hook.
15689 */
15690 ASSERT(state->dts_cred.dcr_cred->cr_zone->zone_dtrace_getf > 0);
15691 ASSERT(dtrace_closef == dtrace_getf_barrier);
15692 ASSERT(dtrace_getf > 0);
15693
15694 state->dts_cred.dcr_cred->cr_zone->zone_dtrace_getf--;
15695
15696 if (--dtrace_getf == 0)
15697 dtrace_closef = NULL;
15698 }
15699#endif
15700
15701 return (0);
15702}
15703
15704static int
15705dtrace_state_option(dtrace_state_t *state, dtrace_optid_t option,
15706 dtrace_optval_t val)
15707{
15708 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
15709
15710 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE)
15711 return (EBUSY);
15712
15713 if (option >= DTRACEOPT_MAX)
15714 return (EINVAL);
15715
15716 if (option != DTRACEOPT_CPU && val < 0)
15717 return (EINVAL);
15718
15719 switch (option) {
15720 case DTRACEOPT_DESTRUCTIVE:
15721 if (dtrace_destructive_disallow)
15722 return (EACCES);
15723
15724 state->dts_cred.dcr_destructive = 1;
15725 break;
15726
15727 case DTRACEOPT_BUFSIZE:
15728 case DTRACEOPT_DYNVARSIZE:
15729 case DTRACEOPT_AGGSIZE:
15730 case DTRACEOPT_SPECSIZE:
15731 case DTRACEOPT_STRSIZE:
15732 if (val < 0)
15733 return (EINVAL);
15734
15735 if (val >= LONG_MAX) {
15736 /*
15737 * If this is an otherwise negative value, set it to
15738 * the highest multiple of 128m less than LONG_MAX.
15739 * Technically, we're adjusting the size without
15740 * regard to the buffer resizing policy, but in fact,
15741 * this has no effect -- if we set the buffer size to
15742 * ~LONG_MAX and the buffer policy is ultimately set to
15743 * be "manual", the buffer allocation is guaranteed to
15744 * fail, if only because the allocation requires two
15745 * buffers. (We set the the size to the highest
15746 * multiple of 128m because it ensures that the size
15747 * will remain a multiple of a megabyte when
15748 * repeatedly halved -- all the way down to 15m.)
15749 */
15750 val = LONG_MAX - (1 << 27) + 1;
15751 }
15752 }
15753
15754 state->dts_options[option] = val;
15755
15756 return (0);
15757}
15758
15759static void
15760dtrace_state_destroy(dtrace_state_t *state)
15761{
15762 dtrace_ecb_t *ecb;
15763 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate = &state->dts_vstate;
15764#ifdef illumos
15765 minor_t minor = getminor(state->dts_dev);
15766#endif
15767 int i, bufsize = NCPU * sizeof (dtrace_buffer_t);
15768 dtrace_speculation_t *spec = state->dts_speculations;
15769 int nspec = state->dts_nspeculations;
15770 uint32_t match;
15771
15772 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
15773 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
15774
15775 /*
15776 * First, retract any retained enablings for this state.
15777 */
15778 dtrace_enabling_retract(state);
15779 ASSERT(state->dts_nretained == 0);
15780
15781 if (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE ||
15782 state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_DRAINING) {
15783 /*
15784 * We have managed to come into dtrace_state_destroy() on a
15785 * hot enabling -- almost certainly because of a disorderly
15786 * shutdown of a consumer. (That is, a consumer that is
15787 * exiting without having called dtrace_stop().) In this case,
15788 * we're going to set our activity to be KILLED, and then
15789 * issue a sync to be sure that everyone is out of probe
15790 * context before we start blowing away ECBs.
15791 */
15792 state->dts_activity = DTRACE_ACTIVITY_KILLED;
15793 dtrace_sync();
15794 }
15795
15796 /*
15797 * Release the credential hold we took in dtrace_state_create().
15798 */
15799 if (state->dts_cred.dcr_cred != NULL)
15800 crfree(state->dts_cred.dcr_cred);
15801
15802 /*
15803 * Now we can safely disable and destroy any enabled probes. Because
15804 * any DTRACE_PRIV_KERNEL probes may actually be slowing our progress
15805 * (especially if they're all enabled), we take two passes through the
15806 * ECBs: in the first, we disable just DTRACE_PRIV_KERNEL probes, and
15807 * in the second we disable whatever is left over.
15808 */
15809 for (match = DTRACE_PRIV_KERNEL; ; match = 0) {
15810 for (i = 0; i < state->dts_necbs; i++) {
15811 if ((ecb = state->dts_ecbs[i]) == NULL)
15812 continue;
15813
15814 if (match && ecb->dte_probe != NULL) {
15815 dtrace_probe_t *probe = ecb->dte_probe;
15816 dtrace_provider_t *prov = probe->dtpr_provider;
15817
15818 if (!(prov->dtpv_priv.dtpp_flags & match))
15819 continue;
15820 }
15821
15822 dtrace_ecb_disable(ecb);
15823 dtrace_ecb_destroy(ecb);
15824 }
15825
15826 if (!match)
15827 break;
15828 }
15829
15830 /*
15831 * Before we free the buffers, perform one more sync to assure that
15832 * every CPU is out of probe context.
15833 */
15834 dtrace_sync();
15835
15836 dtrace_buffer_free(state->dts_buffer);
15837 dtrace_buffer_free(state->dts_aggbuffer);
15838
15839 for (i = 0; i < nspec; i++)
15840 dtrace_buffer_free(spec[i].dtsp_buffer);
15841
15842#ifdef illumos
15843 if (state->dts_cleaner != CYCLIC_NONE)
15844 cyclic_remove(state->dts_cleaner);
15845
15846 if (state->dts_deadman != CYCLIC_NONE)
15847 cyclic_remove(state->dts_deadman);
15848#endif
15849#ifdef __FreeBSD__
15850 callout_stop(&state->dts_cleaner);
15851 callout_drain(&state->dts_cleaner);
15852 callout_stop(&state->dts_deadman);
15853 callout_drain(&state->dts_deadman);
15854#endif
15855#ifdef __NetBSD__
15856 if (state->dts_cleaner != NULL)
15857 dtrace_state_worker_remove(state->dts_cleaner);
15858
15859 if (state->dts_deadman != NULL)
15860 dtrace_state_worker_remove(state->dts_deadman);
15861#endif
15862
15863 dtrace_dstate_fini(&vstate->dtvs_dynvars);
15864 dtrace_vstate_fini(vstate);
15865 if (state->dts_ecbs != NULL)
15866 kmem_free(state->dts_ecbs, state->dts_necbs * sizeof (dtrace_ecb_t *));
15867
15868 if (state->dts_aggregations != NULL) {
15869#ifdef DEBUG
15870 for (i = 0; i < state->dts_naggregations; i++)
15871 ASSERT(state->dts_aggregations[i] == NULL);
15872#endif
15873 ASSERT(state->dts_naggregations > 0);
15874 kmem_free(state->dts_aggregations,
15875 state->dts_naggregations * sizeof (dtrace_aggregation_t *));
15876 }
15877
15878 kmem_free(state->dts_buffer, bufsize);
15879 kmem_free(state->dts_aggbuffer, bufsize);
15880
15881 for (i = 0; i < nspec; i++)
15882 kmem_free(spec[i].dtsp_buffer, bufsize);
15883
15884 if (spec != NULL)
15885 kmem_free(spec, nspec * sizeof (dtrace_speculation_t));
15886
15887 dtrace_format_destroy(state);
15888
15889 if (state->dts_aggid_arena != NULL) {
15890#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
15891 vmem_destroy(state->dts_aggid_arena);
15892#else
15893 delete_unrhdr(state->dts_aggid_arena);
15894#endif
15895 state->dts_aggid_arena = NULL;
15896 }
15897#ifdef illumos
15898 ddi_soft_state_free(dtrace_softstate, minor);
15899 vmem_free(dtrace_minor, (void *)(uintptr_t)minor, 1);
15900#endif
15901#ifdef __NetBSD__
15902 kmem_free(state, sizeof(dtrace_state_t));
15903#endif
15904}
15905
15906/*
15907 * DTrace Anonymous Enabling Functions
15908 */
15909static dtrace_state_t *
15910dtrace_anon_grab(void)
15911{
15912 dtrace_state_t *state;
15913
15914 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
15915
15916 if ((state = dtrace_anon.dta_state) == NULL) {
15917 ASSERT(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling == NULL);
15918 return (NULL);
15919 }
15920
15921 ASSERT(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling != NULL);
15922 ASSERT(dtrace_retained != NULL);
15923
15924 dtrace_enabling_destroy(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling);
15925 dtrace_anon.dta_enabling = NULL;
15926 dtrace_anon.dta_state = NULL;
15927
15928 return (state);
15929}
15930
15931static void
15932dtrace_anon_property(void)
15933{
15934 int i, rv;
15935 dtrace_state_t *state;
15936 dof_hdr_t *dof;
15937 char c[32]; /* enough for "dof-data-" + digits */
15938
15939 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
15940 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
15941
15942 for (i = 0; ; i++) {
15943 (void) snprintf(c, sizeof (c), "dof-data-%d", i);
15944
15945 dtrace_err_verbose = 1;
15946
15947 if ((dof = dtrace_dof_property(c)) == NULL) {
15948 dtrace_err_verbose = 0;
15949 break;
15950 }
15951
15952#ifdef illumos
15953 /*
15954 * We want to create anonymous state, so we need to transition
15955 * the kernel debugger to indicate that DTrace is active. If
15956 * this fails (e.g. because the debugger has modified text in
15957 * some way), we won't continue with the processing.
15958 */
15959 if (kdi_dtrace_set(KDI_DTSET_DTRACE_ACTIVATE) != 0) {
15960 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "kernel debugger active; anonymous "
15961 "enabling ignored.");
15962 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
15963 break;
15964 }
15965#endif
15966
15967 /*
15968 * If we haven't allocated an anonymous state, we'll do so now.
15969 */
15970 if ((state = dtrace_anon.dta_state) == NULL) {
15971 state = dtrace_state_create(NULL, NULL);
15972 dtrace_anon.dta_state = state;
15973
15974 if (state == NULL) {
15975 /*
15976 * This basically shouldn't happen: the only
15977 * failure mode from dtrace_state_create() is a
15978 * failure of ddi_soft_state_zalloc() that
15979 * itself should never happen. Still, the
15980 * interface allows for a failure mode, and
15981 * we want to fail as gracefully as possible:
15982 * we'll emit an error message and cease
15983 * processing anonymous state in this case.
15984 */
15985 cmn_err(CE_WARN, "failed to create "
15986 "anonymous state");
15987 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
15988 break;
15989 }
15990 }
15991
15992 rv = dtrace_dof_slurp(dof, &state->dts_vstate, CRED(),
15993 &dtrace_anon.dta_enabling, 0, 0, B_TRUE);
15994
15995 if (rv == 0)
15996 rv = dtrace_dof_options(dof, state);
15997
15998 dtrace_err_verbose = 0;
15999 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
16000
16001 if (rv != 0) {
16002 /*
16003 * This is malformed DOF; chuck any anonymous state
16004 * that we created.
16005 */
16006 ASSERT(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling == NULL);
16007 dtrace_state_destroy(state);
16008 dtrace_anon.dta_state = NULL;
16009 break;
16010 }
16011
16012 ASSERT(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling != NULL);
16013 }
16014
16015 if (dtrace_anon.dta_enabling != NULL) {
16016 int rval;
16017
16018 /*
16019 * dtrace_enabling_retain() can only fail because we are
16020 * trying to retain more enablings than are allowed -- but
16021 * we only have one anonymous enabling, and we are guaranteed
16022 * to be allowed at least one retained enabling; we assert
16023 * that dtrace_enabling_retain() returns success.
16024 */
16025 rval = dtrace_enabling_retain(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling);
16026 ASSERT(rval == 0);
16027
16028 dtrace_enabling_dump(dtrace_anon.dta_enabling);
16029 }
16030}
16031
16032/*
16033 * DTrace Helper Functions
16034 */
16035static void
16036dtrace_helper_trace(dtrace_helper_action_t *helper,
16037 dtrace_mstate_t *mstate, dtrace_vstate_t *vstate, int where)
16038{
16039 uint32_t size, next, nnext, i;
16040 dtrace_helptrace_t *ent, *buffer;
16041 uint16_t flags = cpu_core[curcpu_id].cpuc_dtrace_flags;
16042
16043 if ((buffer = dtrace_helptrace_buffer) == NULL)
16044 return;
16045
16046 ASSERT(vstate->dtvs_nlocals <= dtrace_helptrace_nlocals);
16047
16048 /*
16049 * What would a tracing framework be without its own tracing
16050 * framework? (Well, a hell of a lot simpler, for starters...)
16051 */
16052 size = sizeof (dtrace_helptrace_t) + dtrace_helptrace_nlocals *
16053 sizeof (uint64_t) - sizeof (uint64_t);
16054
16055 /*
16056 * Iterate until we can allocate a slot in the trace buffer.
16057 */
16058 do {
16059 next = dtrace_helptrace_next;
16060
16061 if (next + size < dtrace_helptrace_bufsize) {
16062 nnext = next + size;
16063 } else {
16064 nnext = size;
16065 }
16066 } while (dtrace_cas32(&dtrace_helptrace_next, next, nnext) != next);
16067
16068 /*
16069 * We have our slot; fill it in.
16070 */
16071 if (nnext == size) {
16072 dtrace_helptrace_wrapped++;
16073 next = 0;
16074 }
16075
16076 ent = (dtrace_helptrace_t *)((uintptr_t)buffer + next);
16077 ent->dtht_helper = helper;
16078 ent->dtht_where = where;
16079 ent->dtht_nlocals = vstate->dtvs_nlocals;
16080
16081 ent->dtht_fltoffs = (mstate->dtms_present & DTRACE_MSTATE_FLTOFFS) ?
16082 mstate->dtms_fltoffs : -1;
16083 ent->dtht_fault = DTRACE_FLAGS2FLT(flags);
16084 ent->dtht_illval = cpu_core[curcpu_id].cpuc_dtrace_illval;
16085
16086 for (i = 0; i < vstate->dtvs_nlocals; i++) {
16087 dtrace_statvar_t *svar;
16088
16089 if ((svar = vstate->dtvs_locals[i]) == NULL)
16090 continue;
16091
16092 ASSERT(svar->dtsv_size >= NCPU * sizeof (uint64_t));
16093 ent->dtht_locals[i] =
16094 ((uint64_t *)(uintptr_t)svar->dtsv_data)[curcpu_id];
16095 }
16096}
16097
16098static uint64_t
16099dtrace_helper(int which, dtrace_mstate_t *mstate,
16100 dtrace_state_t *state, uint64_t arg0, uint64_t arg1)
16101{
16102 uint16_t *flags = &cpu_core[curcpu_id].cpuc_dtrace_flags;
16103 uint64_t sarg0 = mstate->dtms_arg[0];
16104 uint64_t sarg1 = mstate->dtms_arg[1];
16105 uint64_t rval = 0;
16106 dtrace_helpers_t *helpers = curproc->p_dtrace_helpers;
16107 dtrace_helper_action_t *helper;
16108 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
16109 dtrace_difo_t *pred;
16110 int i, trace = dtrace_helptrace_buffer != NULL;
16111
16112 ASSERT(which >= 0 && which < DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS);
16113
16114 if (helpers == NULL)
16115 return (0);
16116
16117 if ((helper = helpers->dthps_actions[which]) == NULL)
16118 return (0);
16119
16120 vstate = &helpers->dthps_vstate;
16121 mstate->dtms_arg[0] = arg0;
16122 mstate->dtms_arg[1] = arg1;
16123
16124 /*
16125 * Now iterate over each helper. If its predicate evaluates to 'true',
16126 * we'll call the corresponding actions. Note that the below calls
16127 * to dtrace_dif_emulate() may set faults in machine state. This is
16128 * okay: our caller (the outer dtrace_dif_emulate()) will simply plow
16129 * the stored DIF offset with its own (which is the desired behavior).
16130 * Also, note the calls to dtrace_dif_emulate() may allocate scratch
16131 * from machine state; this is okay, too.
16132 */
16133 for (; helper != NULL; helper = helper->dtha_next) {
16134 if ((pred = helper->dtha_predicate) != NULL) {
16135 if (trace)
16136 dtrace_helper_trace(helper, mstate, vstate, 0);
16137
16138 if (!dtrace_dif_emulate(pred, mstate, vstate, state))
16139 goto next;
16140
16141 if (*flags & CPU_DTRACE_FAULT)
16142 goto err;
16143 }
16144
16145 for (i = 0; i < helper->dtha_nactions; i++) {
16146 if (trace)
16147 dtrace_helper_trace(helper,
16148 mstate, vstate, i + 1);
16149
16150 rval = dtrace_dif_emulate(helper->dtha_actions[i],
16151 mstate, vstate, state);
16152
16153 if (*flags & CPU_DTRACE_FAULT)
16154 goto err;
16155 }
16156
16157next:
16158 if (trace)
16159 dtrace_helper_trace(helper, mstate, vstate,
16160 DTRACE_HELPTRACE_NEXT);
16161 }
16162
16163 if (trace)
16164 dtrace_helper_trace(helper, mstate, vstate,
16165 DTRACE_HELPTRACE_DONE);
16166
16167 /*
16168 * Restore the arg0 that we saved upon entry.
16169 */
16170 mstate->dtms_arg[0] = sarg0;
16171 mstate->dtms_arg[1] = sarg1;
16172
16173 return (rval);
16174
16175err:
16176 if (trace)
16177 dtrace_helper_trace(helper, mstate, vstate,
16178 DTRACE_HELPTRACE_ERR);
16179
16180 /*
16181 * Restore the arg0 that we saved upon entry.
16182 */
16183 mstate->dtms_arg[0] = sarg0;
16184 mstate->dtms_arg[1] = sarg1;
16185
16186 return (0);
16187}
16188
16189static void
16190dtrace_helper_action_destroy(dtrace_helper_action_t *helper,
16191 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate)
16192{
16193 int i;
16194
16195 if (helper->dtha_predicate != NULL)
16196 dtrace_difo_release(helper->dtha_predicate, vstate);
16197
16198 for (i = 0; i < helper->dtha_nactions; i++) {
16199 ASSERT(helper->dtha_actions[i] != NULL);
16200 dtrace_difo_release(helper->dtha_actions[i], vstate);
16201 }
16202
16203 kmem_free(helper->dtha_actions,
16204 helper->dtha_nactions * sizeof (dtrace_difo_t *));
16205 kmem_free(helper, sizeof (dtrace_helper_action_t));
16206}
16207
16208static int
16209dtrace_helper_destroygen(dtrace_helpers_t *help, int gen)
16210{
16211 proc_t *p = curproc;
16212 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
16213 int i;
16214
16215 if (help == NULL)
16216 help = p->p_dtrace_helpers;
16217
16218 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
16219
16220 if (help == NULL || gen > help->dthps_generation)
16221 return (EINVAL);
16222
16223 vstate = &help->dthps_vstate;
16224
16225 for (i = 0; i < DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS; i++) {
16226 dtrace_helper_action_t *last = NULL, *h, *next;
16227
16228 for (h = help->dthps_actions[i]; h != NULL; h = next) {
16229 next = h->dtha_next;
16230
16231 if (h->dtha_generation == gen) {
16232 if (last != NULL) {
16233 last->dtha_next = next;
16234 } else {
16235 help->dthps_actions[i] = next;
16236 }
16237
16238 dtrace_helper_action_destroy(h, vstate);
16239 } else {
16240 last = h;
16241 }
16242 }
16243 }
16244
16245 /*
16246 * Interate until we've cleared out all helper providers with the
16247 * given generation number.
16248 */
16249 for (;;) {
16250 dtrace_helper_provider_t *prov;
16251
16252 /*
16253 * Look for a helper provider with the right generation. We
16254 * have to start back at the beginning of the list each time
16255 * because we drop dtrace_lock. It's unlikely that we'll make
16256 * more than two passes.
16257 */
16258 for (i = 0; i < help->dthps_nprovs; i++) {
16259 prov = help->dthps_provs[i];
16260
16261 if (prov->dthp_generation == gen)
16262 break;
16263 }
16264
16265 /*
16266 * If there were no matches, we're done.
16267 */
16268 if (i == help->dthps_nprovs)
16269 break;
16270
16271 /*
16272 * Move the last helper provider into this slot.
16273 */
16274 help->dthps_nprovs--;
16275 help->dthps_provs[i] = help->dthps_provs[help->dthps_nprovs];
16276 help->dthps_provs[help->dthps_nprovs] = NULL;
16277
16278 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16279
16280 /*
16281 * If we have a meta provider, remove this helper provider.
16282 */
16283 mutex_enter(&dtrace_meta_lock);
16284 if (dtrace_meta_pid != NULL) {
16285 ASSERT(dtrace_deferred_pid == NULL);
16286 dtrace_helper_provider_remove(&prov->dthp_prov,
16287 p->p_pid);
16288 }
16289 mutex_exit(&dtrace_meta_lock);
16290
16291 dtrace_helper_provider_destroy(prov);
16292
16293 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16294 }
16295
16296 return (0);
16297}
16298
16299static int
16300dtrace_helper_validate(dtrace_helper_action_t *helper)
16301{
16302 int err = 0, i;
16303 dtrace_difo_t *dp;
16304
16305 if ((dp = helper->dtha_predicate) != NULL)
16306 err += dtrace_difo_validate_helper(dp);
16307
16308 for (i = 0; i < helper->dtha_nactions; i++)
16309 err += dtrace_difo_validate_helper(helper->dtha_actions[i]);
16310
16311 return (err == 0);
16312}
16313
16314static int
16315dtrace_helper_action_add(int which, dtrace_ecbdesc_t *ep,
16316 dtrace_helpers_t *help)
16317{
16318 dtrace_helper_action_t *helper, *last;
16319 dtrace_actdesc_t *act;
16320 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
16321 dtrace_predicate_t *pred;
16322 int count = 0, nactions = 0, i;
16323
16324 if (which < 0 || which >= DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS)
16325 return (EINVAL);
16326
16327 last = help->dthps_actions[which];
16328 vstate = &help->dthps_vstate;
16329
16330 for (count = 0; last != NULL; last = last->dtha_next) {
16331 count++;
16332 if (last->dtha_next == NULL)
16333 break;
16334 }
16335
16336 /*
16337 * If we already have dtrace_helper_actions_max helper actions for this
16338 * helper action type, we'll refuse to add a new one.
16339 */
16340 if (count >= dtrace_helper_actions_max)
16341 return (ENOSPC);
16342
16343 helper = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_helper_action_t), KM_SLEEP);
16344 helper->dtha_generation = help->dthps_generation;
16345
16346 if ((pred = ep->dted_pred.dtpdd_predicate) != NULL) {
16347 ASSERT(pred->dtp_difo != NULL);
16348 dtrace_difo_hold(pred->dtp_difo);
16349 helper->dtha_predicate = pred->dtp_difo;
16350 }
16351
16352 for (act = ep->dted_action; act != NULL; act = act->dtad_next) {
16353 if (act->dtad_kind != DTRACEACT_DIFEXPR)
16354 goto err;
16355
16356 if (act->dtad_difo == NULL)
16357 goto err;
16358
16359 nactions++;
16360 }
16361
16362 helper->dtha_actions = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_difo_t *) *
16363 (helper->dtha_nactions = nactions), KM_SLEEP);
16364
16365 for (act = ep->dted_action, i = 0; act != NULL; act = act->dtad_next) {
16366 dtrace_difo_hold(act->dtad_difo);
16367 helper->dtha_actions[i++] = act->dtad_difo;
16368 }
16369
16370 if (!dtrace_helper_validate(helper))
16371 goto err;
16372
16373 if (last == NULL) {
16374 help->dthps_actions[which] = helper;
16375 } else {
16376 last->dtha_next = helper;
16377 }
16378
16379 if (vstate->dtvs_nlocals > dtrace_helptrace_nlocals) {
16380 dtrace_helptrace_nlocals = vstate->dtvs_nlocals;
16381 dtrace_helptrace_next = 0;
16382 }
16383
16384 return (0);
16385err:
16386 dtrace_helper_action_destroy(helper, vstate);
16387 return (EINVAL);
16388}
16389
16390static void
16391dtrace_helper_provider_register(proc_t *p, dtrace_helpers_t *help,
16392 dof_helper_t *dofhp)
16393{
16394 ASSERT(MUTEX_NOT_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
16395
16396 mutex_enter(&dtrace_meta_lock);
16397 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16398
16399 if (!dtrace_attached() || dtrace_meta_pid == NULL) {
16400 /*
16401 * If the dtrace module is loaded but not attached, or if
16402 * there aren't isn't a meta provider registered to deal with
16403 * these provider descriptions, we need to postpone creating
16404 * the actual providers until later.
16405 */
16406
16407 if (help->dthps_next == NULL && help->dthps_prev == NULL &&
16408 dtrace_deferred_pid != help) {
16409 help->dthps_deferred = 1;
16410 help->dthps_pid = p->p_pid;
16411 help->dthps_next = dtrace_deferred_pid;
16412 help->dthps_prev = NULL;
16413 if (dtrace_deferred_pid != NULL)
16414 dtrace_deferred_pid->dthps_prev = help;
16415 dtrace_deferred_pid = help;
16416 }
16417
16418 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16419
16420 } else if (dofhp != NULL) {
16421 /*
16422 * If the dtrace module is loaded and we have a particular
16423 * helper provider description, pass that off to the
16424 * meta provider.
16425 */
16426
16427 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16428
16429 dtrace_helper_provide(dofhp, p->p_pid);
16430
16431 } else {
16432 /*
16433 * Otherwise, just pass all the helper provider descriptions
16434 * off to the meta provider.
16435 */
16436
16437 int i;
16438 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16439
16440 for (i = 0; i < help->dthps_nprovs; i++) {
16441 dtrace_helper_provide(&help->dthps_provs[i]->dthp_prov,
16442 p->p_pid);
16443 }
16444 }
16445
16446 mutex_exit(&dtrace_meta_lock);
16447}
16448
16449static int
16450dtrace_helper_provider_add(dof_helper_t *dofhp, dtrace_helpers_t *help, int gen)
16451{
16452 dtrace_helper_provider_t *hprov, **tmp_provs;
16453 uint_t tmp_maxprovs, i;
16454
16455 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
16456 ASSERT(help != NULL);
16457
16458 /*
16459 * If we already have dtrace_helper_providers_max helper providers,
16460 * we're refuse to add a new one.
16461 */
16462 if (help->dthps_nprovs >= dtrace_helper_providers_max)
16463 return (ENOSPC);
16464
16465 /*
16466 * Check to make sure this isn't a duplicate.
16467 */
16468 for (i = 0; i < help->dthps_nprovs; i++) {
16469 if (dofhp->dofhp_addr ==
16470 help->dthps_provs[i]->dthp_prov.dofhp_addr)
16471 return (EALREADY);
16472 }
16473
16474 hprov = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t), KM_SLEEP);
16475 hprov->dthp_prov = *dofhp;
16476 hprov->dthp_ref = 1;
16477 hprov->dthp_generation = gen;
16478
16479 /*
16480 * Allocate a bigger table for helper providers if it's already full.
16481 */
16482 if (help->dthps_maxprovs == help->dthps_nprovs) {
16483 tmp_maxprovs = help->dthps_maxprovs;
16484 tmp_provs = help->dthps_provs;
16485
16486 if (help->dthps_maxprovs == 0)
16487 help->dthps_maxprovs = 2;
16488 else
16489 help->dthps_maxprovs *= 2;
16490 if (help->dthps_maxprovs > dtrace_helper_providers_max)
16491 help->dthps_maxprovs = dtrace_helper_providers_max;
16492
16493 ASSERT(tmp_maxprovs < help->dthps_maxprovs);
16494
16495 help->dthps_provs = kmem_zalloc(help->dthps_maxprovs *
16496 sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t *), KM_SLEEP);
16497
16498 if (tmp_provs != NULL) {
16499 bcopy(tmp_provs, help->dthps_provs, tmp_maxprovs *
16500 sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t *));
16501 kmem_free(tmp_provs, tmp_maxprovs *
16502 sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t *));
16503 }
16504 }
16505
16506 help->dthps_provs[help->dthps_nprovs] = hprov;
16507 help->dthps_nprovs++;
16508
16509 return (0);
16510}
16511
16512static void
16513dtrace_helper_provider_destroy(dtrace_helper_provider_t *hprov)
16514{
16515 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16516
16517 if (--hprov->dthp_ref == 0) {
16518 dof_hdr_t *dof;
16519 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16520 dof = (dof_hdr_t *)(uintptr_t)hprov->dthp_prov.dofhp_dof;
16521 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
16522 kmem_free(hprov, sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t));
16523 } else {
16524 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16525 }
16526}
16527
16528static int
16529dtrace_helper_provider_validate(dof_hdr_t *dof, dof_sec_t *sec)
16530{
16531 uintptr_t daddr = (uintptr_t)dof;
16532 dof_sec_t *str_sec, *prb_sec, *arg_sec, *off_sec, *enoff_sec;
16533 dof_provider_t *provider;
16534 dof_probe_t *probe;
16535 uint8_t *arg;
16536 char *strtab, *typestr;
16537 dof_stridx_t typeidx;
16538 size_t typesz;
16539 uint_t nprobes, j, k;
16540
16541 ASSERT(sec->dofs_type == DOF_SECT_PROVIDER);
16542
16543 if (sec->dofs_offset & (sizeof (uint_t) - 1)) {
16544 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned section offset");
16545 return (-1);
16546 }
16547
16548 /*
16549 * The section needs to be large enough to contain the DOF provider
16550 * structure appropriate for the given version.
16551 */
16552 if (sec->dofs_size <
16553 ((dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_VERSION] == DOF_VERSION_1) ?
16554 offsetof(dof_provider_t, dofpv_prenoffs) :
16555 sizeof (dof_provider_t))) {
16556 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "provider section too small");
16557 return (-1);
16558 }
16559
16560 provider = (dof_provider_t *)(uintptr_t)(daddr + sec->dofs_offset);
16561 str_sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_STRTAB, provider->dofpv_strtab);
16562 prb_sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_PROBES, provider->dofpv_probes);
16563 arg_sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_PRARGS, provider->dofpv_prargs);
16564 off_sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_PROFFS, provider->dofpv_proffs);
16565
16566 if (str_sec == NULL || prb_sec == NULL ||
16567 arg_sec == NULL || off_sec == NULL)
16568 return (-1);
16569
16570 enoff_sec = NULL;
16571
16572 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_VERSION] != DOF_VERSION_1 &&
16573 provider->dofpv_prenoffs != DOF_SECT_NONE &&
16574 (enoff_sec = dtrace_dof_sect(dof, DOF_SECT_PRENOFFS,
16575 provider->dofpv_prenoffs)) == NULL)
16576 return (-1);
16577
16578 strtab = (char *)(uintptr_t)(daddr + str_sec->dofs_offset);
16579
16580 if (provider->dofpv_name >= str_sec->dofs_size ||
16581 strlen(strtab + provider->dofpv_name) >= DTRACE_PROVNAMELEN) {
16582 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid provider name");
16583 return (-1);
16584 }
16585
16586 if (prb_sec->dofs_entsize == 0 ||
16587 prb_sec->dofs_entsize > prb_sec->dofs_size) {
16588 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid entry size");
16589 return (-1);
16590 }
16591
16592 if (prb_sec->dofs_entsize & (sizeof (uintptr_t) - 1)) {
16593 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned entry size");
16594 return (-1);
16595 }
16596
16597 if (off_sec->dofs_entsize != sizeof (uint32_t)) {
16598 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid entry size");
16599 return (-1);
16600 }
16601
16602 if (off_sec->dofs_offset & (sizeof (uint32_t) - 1)) {
16603 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "misaligned section offset");
16604 return (-1);
16605 }
16606
16607 if (arg_sec->dofs_entsize != sizeof (uint8_t)) {
16608 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid entry size");
16609 return (-1);
16610 }
16611
16612 arg = (uint8_t *)(uintptr_t)(daddr + arg_sec->dofs_offset);
16613
16614 nprobes = prb_sec->dofs_size / prb_sec->dofs_entsize;
16615
16616 /*
16617 * Take a pass through the probes to check for errors.
16618 */
16619 for (j = 0; j < nprobes; j++) {
16620 probe = (dof_probe_t *)(uintptr_t)(daddr +
16621 prb_sec->dofs_offset + j * prb_sec->dofs_entsize);
16622
16623 if (probe->dofpr_func >= str_sec->dofs_size) {
16624 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid function name");
16625 return (-1);
16626 }
16627
16628 if (strlen(strtab + probe->dofpr_func) >= DTRACE_FUNCNAMELEN) {
16629 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "function name too long");
16630 /*
16631 * Keep going if the function name is too long.
16632 * Unlike provider and probe names, we cannot reasonably
16633 * impose restrictions on function names, since they're
16634 * a property of the code being instrumented. We will
16635 * skip this probe in dtrace_helper_provide_one().
16636 */
16637 }
16638
16639 if (probe->dofpr_name >= str_sec->dofs_size ||
16640 strlen(strtab + probe->dofpr_name) >= DTRACE_NAMELEN) {
16641 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid probe name");
16642 return (-1);
16643 }
16644
16645 /*
16646 * The offset count must not wrap the index, and the offsets
16647 * must also not overflow the section's data.
16648 */
16649 if (probe->dofpr_offidx + probe->dofpr_noffs <
16650 probe->dofpr_offidx ||
16651 (probe->dofpr_offidx + probe->dofpr_noffs) *
16652 off_sec->dofs_entsize > off_sec->dofs_size) {
16653 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid probe offset");
16654 return (-1);
16655 }
16656
16657 if (dof->dofh_ident[DOF_ID_VERSION] != DOF_VERSION_1) {
16658 /*
16659 * If there's no is-enabled offset section, make sure
16660 * there aren't any is-enabled offsets. Otherwise
16661 * perform the same checks as for probe offsets
16662 * (immediately above).
16663 */
16664 if (enoff_sec == NULL) {
16665 if (probe->dofpr_enoffidx != 0 ||
16666 probe->dofpr_nenoffs != 0) {
16667 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "is-enabled "
16668 "offsets with null section");
16669 return (-1);
16670 }
16671 } else if (probe->dofpr_enoffidx +
16672 probe->dofpr_nenoffs < probe->dofpr_enoffidx ||
16673 (probe->dofpr_enoffidx + probe->dofpr_nenoffs) *
16674 enoff_sec->dofs_entsize > enoff_sec->dofs_size) {
16675 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid is-enabled "
16676 "offset");
16677 return (-1);
16678 }
16679
16680 if (probe->dofpr_noffs + probe->dofpr_nenoffs == 0) {
16681 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "zero probe and "
16682 "is-enabled offsets");
16683 return (-1);
16684 }
16685 } else if (probe->dofpr_noffs == 0) {
16686 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "zero probe offsets");
16687 return (-1);
16688 }
16689
16690 if (probe->dofpr_argidx + probe->dofpr_xargc <
16691 probe->dofpr_argidx ||
16692 (probe->dofpr_argidx + probe->dofpr_xargc) *
16693 arg_sec->dofs_entsize > arg_sec->dofs_size) {
16694 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "invalid args");
16695 return (-1);
16696 }
16697
16698 typeidx = probe->dofpr_nargv;
16699 typestr = strtab + probe->dofpr_nargv;
16700 for (k = 0; k < probe->dofpr_nargc; k++) {
16701 if (typeidx >= str_sec->dofs_size) {
16702 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad "
16703 "native argument type");
16704 return (-1);
16705 }
16706
16707 typesz = strlen(typestr) + 1;
16708 if (typesz > DTRACE_ARGTYPELEN) {
16709 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "native "
16710 "argument type too long");
16711 return (-1);
16712 }
16713 typeidx += typesz;
16714 typestr += typesz;
16715 }
16716
16717 typeidx = probe->dofpr_xargv;
16718 typestr = strtab + probe->dofpr_xargv;
16719 for (k = 0; k < probe->dofpr_xargc; k++) {
16720 if (arg[probe->dofpr_argidx + k] > probe->dofpr_nargc) {
16721 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad "
