16722 "native argument index");
16723 return (-1);
16724 }
16725
16726 if (typeidx >= str_sec->dofs_size) {
16727 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "bad "
16728 "translated argument type");
16729 return (-1);
16730 }
16731
16732 typesz = strlen(typestr) + 1;
16733 if (typesz > DTRACE_ARGTYPELEN) {
16734 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "translated argument "
16735 "type too long");
16736 return (-1);
16737 }
16738
16739 typeidx += typesz;
16740 typestr += typesz;
16741 }
16742 }
16743
16744 return (0);
16745}
16746
16747static int
16748dtrace_helper_slurp(dof_hdr_t *dof, dof_helper_t *dhp, struct proc *p)
16749{
16750 dtrace_helpers_t *help;
16751 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
16752 dtrace_enabling_t *enab = NULL;
16753 int i, gen, rv, nhelpers = 0, nprovs = 0, destroy = 1;
16754 uintptr_t daddr = (uintptr_t)dof;
16755
16756 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
16757
16758 if ((help = p->p_dtrace_helpers) == NULL)
16759 help = dtrace_helpers_create(p);
16760
16761 vstate = &help->dthps_vstate;
16762 if ((rv = dtrace_dof_slurp(dof, vstate, NULL, &enab, dhp->dofhp_addr,
16763 dhp->dofhp_dof, B_FALSE)) != 0) {
16764 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
16765 return (rv);
16766 }
16767
16768 /*
16769 * Look for helper providers and validate their descriptions.
16770 */
16771 for (i = 0; i < dof->dofh_secnum; i++) {
16772 dof_sec_t *sec = (dof_sec_t *)(uintptr_t)(daddr +
16773 dof->dofh_secoff + i * dof->dofh_secsize);
16774
16775 if (sec->dofs_type != DOF_SECT_PROVIDER)
16776 continue;
16777
16778 if (dtrace_helper_provider_validate(dof, sec) != 0) {
16779 dtrace_enabling_destroy(enab);
16780 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
16781 return (-1);
16782 }
16783
16784 nprovs++;
16785 }
16786
16787 /*
16788 * Now we need to walk through the ECB descriptions in the enabling.
16789 */
16790 for (i = 0; i < enab->dten_ndesc; i++) {
16791 dtrace_ecbdesc_t *ep = enab->dten_desc[i];
16792 dtrace_probedesc_t *desc = &ep->dted_probe;
16793
16794 if (strcmp(desc->dtpd_provider, "dtrace") != 0)
16795 continue;
16796
16797 if (strcmp(desc->dtpd_mod, "helper") != 0)
16798 continue;
16799
16800 if (strcmp(desc->dtpd_func, "ustack") != 0)
16801 continue;
16802
16803 if ((rv = dtrace_helper_action_add(DTRACE_HELPER_ACTION_USTACK,
16804 ep, help)) != 0) {
16805 /*
16806 * Adding this helper action failed -- we are now going
16807 * to rip out the entire generation and return failure.
16808 */
16809 (void) dtrace_helper_destroygen(help,
16810 help->dthps_generation);
16811 dtrace_enabling_destroy(enab);
16812 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
16813 return (-1);
16814 }
16815
16816 nhelpers++;
16817 }
16818
16819 if (nhelpers < enab->dten_ndesc)
16820 dtrace_dof_error(dof, "unmatched helpers");
16821
16822 gen = help->dthps_generation++;
16823 dtrace_enabling_destroy(enab);
16824
16825 if (nprovs > 0) {
16826 /*
16827 * Now that this is in-kernel, we change the sense of the
16828 * members: dofhp_dof denotes the in-kernel copy of the DOF
16829 * and dofhp_addr denotes the address at user-level.
16830 */
16831 dhp->dofhp_addr = dhp->dofhp_dof;
16832 dhp->dofhp_dof = (uint64_t)(uintptr_t)dof;
16833
16834 if (dtrace_helper_provider_add(dhp, help, gen) == 0) {
16835 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16836 dtrace_helper_provider_register(p, help, dhp);
16837 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16838
16839 destroy = 0;
16840 }
16841 }
16842
16843 if (destroy)
16844 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
16845
16846 return (gen);
16847}
16848
16849static dtrace_helpers_t *
16850dtrace_helpers_create(proc_t *p)
16851{
16852 dtrace_helpers_t *help;
16853
16854 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&dtrace_lock));
16855 ASSERT(p->p_dtrace_helpers == NULL);
16856
16857 help = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_helpers_t), KM_SLEEP);
16858 help->dthps_actions = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_helper_action_t *) *
16859 DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS, KM_SLEEP);
16860
16861 p->p_dtrace_helpers = help;
16862 dtrace_helpers++;
16863
16864 return (help);
16865}
16866
16867#ifdef illumos
16868static
16869#endif
16870void
16871dtrace_helpers_destroy(proc_t *p)
16872{
16873 dtrace_helpers_t *help;
16874 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
16875#ifdef illumos
16876 proc_t *p = curproc;
16877#endif
16878 int i;
16879
16880 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16881
16882 ASSERT(p->p_dtrace_helpers != NULL);
16883 ASSERT(dtrace_helpers > 0);
16884
16885 help = p->p_dtrace_helpers;
16886 vstate = &help->dthps_vstate;
16887
16888 /*
16889 * We're now going to lose the help from this process.
16890 */
16891 p->p_dtrace_helpers = NULL;
16892 dtrace_sync();
16893
16894 /*
16895 * Destory the helper actions.
16896 */
16897 for (i = 0; i < DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS; i++) {
16898 dtrace_helper_action_t *h, *next;
16899
16900 for (h = help->dthps_actions[i]; h != NULL; h = next) {
16901 next = h->dtha_next;
16902 dtrace_helper_action_destroy(h, vstate);
16903 h = next;
16904 }
16905 }
16906
16907 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16908
16909 /*
16910 * Destroy the helper providers.
16911 */
16912 if (help->dthps_maxprovs > 0) {
16913 mutex_enter(&dtrace_meta_lock);
16914 if (dtrace_meta_pid != NULL) {
16915 ASSERT(dtrace_deferred_pid == NULL);
16916
16917 for (i = 0; i < help->dthps_nprovs; i++) {
16918 dtrace_helper_provider_remove(
16919 &help->dthps_provs[i]->dthp_prov, p->p_pid);
16920 }
16921 } else {
16922 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16923 ASSERT(help->dthps_deferred == 0 ||
16924 help->dthps_next != NULL ||
16925 help->dthps_prev != NULL ||
16926 help == dtrace_deferred_pid);
16927
16928 /*
16929 * Remove the helper from the deferred list.
16930 */
16931 if (help->dthps_next != NULL)
16932 help->dthps_next->dthps_prev = help->dthps_prev;
16933 if (help->dthps_prev != NULL)
16934 help->dthps_prev->dthps_next = help->dthps_next;
16935 if (dtrace_deferred_pid == help) {
16936 dtrace_deferred_pid = help->dthps_next;
16937 ASSERT(help->dthps_prev == NULL);
16938 }
16939
16940 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16941 }
16942
16943 mutex_exit(&dtrace_meta_lock);
16944
16945 for (i = 0; i < help->dthps_nprovs; i++) {
16946 dtrace_helper_provider_destroy(help->dthps_provs[i]);
16947 }
16948
16949 kmem_free(help->dthps_provs, help->dthps_maxprovs *
16950 sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t *));
16951 }
16952
16953 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16954
16955 dtrace_vstate_fini(&help->dthps_vstate);
16956 kmem_free(help->dthps_actions,
16957 sizeof (dtrace_helper_action_t *) * DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS);
16958 kmem_free(help, sizeof (dtrace_helpers_t));
16959
16960 --dtrace_helpers;
16961 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
16962}
16963
16964#ifdef illumos
16965static
16966#endif
16967void
16968dtrace_helpers_duplicate(proc_t *from, proc_t *to)
16969{
16970 dtrace_helpers_t *help, *newhelp;
16971 dtrace_helper_action_t *helper, *new, *last;
16972 dtrace_difo_t *dp;
16973 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
16974 int i, j, sz, hasprovs = 0;
16975
16976 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
16977 ASSERT(from->p_dtrace_helpers != NULL);
16978 ASSERT(dtrace_helpers > 0);
16979
16980 help = from->p_dtrace_helpers;
16981 newhelp = dtrace_helpers_create(to);
16982 ASSERT(to->p_dtrace_helpers != NULL);
16983
16984 newhelp->dthps_generation = help->dthps_generation;
16985 vstate = &newhelp->dthps_vstate;
16986
16987 /*
16988 * Duplicate the helper actions.
16989 */
16990 for (i = 0; i < DTRACE_NHELPER_ACTIONS; i++) {
16991 if ((helper = help->dthps_actions[i]) == NULL)
16992 continue;
16993
16994 for (last = NULL; helper != NULL; helper = helper->dtha_next) {
16995 new = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (dtrace_helper_action_t),
16996 KM_SLEEP);
16997 new->dtha_generation = helper->dtha_generation;
16998
16999 if ((dp = helper->dtha_predicate) != NULL) {
17000 dp = dtrace_difo_duplicate(dp, vstate);
17001 new->dtha_predicate = dp;
17002 }
17003
17004 new->dtha_nactions = helper->dtha_nactions;
17005 sz = sizeof (dtrace_difo_t *) * new->dtha_nactions;
17006 new->dtha_actions = kmem_alloc(sz, KM_SLEEP);
17007
17008 for (j = 0; j < new->dtha_nactions; j++) {
17009 dtrace_difo_t *dp = helper->dtha_actions[j];
17010
17011 ASSERT(dp != NULL);
17012 dp = dtrace_difo_duplicate(dp, vstate);
17013 new->dtha_actions[j] = dp;
17014 }
17015
17016 if (last != NULL) {
17017 last->dtha_next = new;
17018 } else {
17019 newhelp->dthps_actions[i] = new;
17020 }
17021
17022 last = new;
17023 }
17024 }
17025
17026 /*
17027 * Duplicate the helper providers and register them with the
17028 * DTrace framework.
17029 */
17030 if (help->dthps_nprovs > 0) {
17031 newhelp->dthps_nprovs = help->dthps_nprovs;
17032 newhelp->dthps_maxprovs = help->dthps_nprovs;
17033 newhelp->dthps_provs = kmem_alloc(newhelp->dthps_nprovs *
17034 sizeof (dtrace_helper_provider_t *), KM_SLEEP);
17035 for (i = 0; i < newhelp->dthps_nprovs; i++) {
17036 newhelp->dthps_provs[i] = help->dthps_provs[i];
17037 newhelp->dthps_provs[i]->dthp_ref++;
17038 }
17039
17040 hasprovs = 1;
17041 }
17042
17043 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17044
17045 if (hasprovs)
17046 dtrace_helper_provider_register(to, newhelp, NULL);
17047}
17048
17049/*
17050 * DTrace Hook Functions
17051 */
17052static void
17053dtrace_module_loaded(modctl_t *ctl)
17054{
17055 dtrace_provider_t *prv;
17056
17057#ifdef __NetBSD__
17058 /*
17059 * We have just one symbol table and CTF table for the entire
17060 * base kernel, so ignore any other built-in module entries.
17061 * This means that the module name for a given symbol will change
17062 * depending on whether the module is built-in or loaded separately.
17063 */
17064 if (module_source(ctl) == MODULE_SOURCE_KERNEL &&
17065 strcmp(module_name(ctl), "netbsd")) {
17066 return;
17067 }
17068#endif
17069
17070 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17071#ifdef illumos
17072 mutex_enter(&mod_lock);
17073#endif
17074
17075#ifdef illumos
17076 ASSERT(ctl->mod_busy);
17077#endif
17078
17079 /*
17080 * We're going to call each providers per-module provide operation
17081 * specifying only this module.
17082 */
17083 for (prv = dtrace_provider; prv != NULL; prv = prv->dtpv_next)
17084 prv->dtpv_pops.dtps_provide_module(prv->dtpv_arg, ctl);
17085
17086#ifdef illumos
17087 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
17088#endif
17089 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17090
17091 /*
17092 * If we have any retained enablings, we need to match against them.
17093 * Enabling probes requires that cpu_lock be held, and we cannot hold
17094 * cpu_lock here -- it is legal for cpu_lock to be held when loading a
17095 * module. (In particular, this happens when loading scheduling
17096 * classes.) So if we have any retained enablings, we need to dispatch
17097 * our task queue to do the match for us.
17098 */
17099 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17100
17101 if (dtrace_retained == NULL) {
17102 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17103 return;
17104 }
17105
17106 (void) taskq_dispatch(dtrace_taskq,
17107 (task_func_t *)dtrace_enabling_matchall, NULL, TQ_SLEEP);
17108
17109 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17110
17111 /*
17112 * And now, for a little heuristic sleaze: in general, we want to
17113 * match modules as soon as they load. However, we cannot guarantee
17114 * this, because it would lead us to the lock ordering violation
17115 * outlined above. The common case, of course, is that cpu_lock is
17116 * _not_ held -- so we delay here for a clock tick, hoping that that's
17117 * long enough for the task queue to do its work. If it's not, it's
17118 * not a serious problem -- it just means that the module that we
17119 * just loaded may not be immediately instrumentable.
17120 */
17121 delay(1);
17122}
17123
17124static void
17125#ifndef __FreeBSD__
17126dtrace_module_unloaded(modctl_t *ctl)
17127#else
17128dtrace_module_unloaded(modctl_t *ctl, int *error)
17129#endif
17130{
17131 dtrace_probe_t template, *probe, *first, *next;
17132 dtrace_provider_t *prov;
17133#ifndef illumos
17134 char modname[DTRACE_MODNAMELEN];
17135 size_t len;
17136#endif
17137
17138#ifdef illumos
17139 template.dtpr_mod = ctl->mod_modname;
17140#endif
17141#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17142 /* Handle the fact that ctl->filename may end in ".ko". */
17143 strlcpy(modname, ctl->filename, sizeof(modname));
17144 len = strlen(ctl->filename);
17145 if (len > 3 && strcmp(modname + len - 3, ".ko") == 0)
17146 modname[len - 3] = '\0';
17147 template.dtpr_mod = modname;
17148#endif
17149#ifdef __NetBSD__
17150 if (module_source(ctl) == MODULE_SOURCE_KERNEL &&
17151 strcmp(module_name(ctl), "netbsd")) {
17152 return;
17153 }
17154
17155 /* Handle the fact that ctl->filename may end in ".kmod". */
17156 strlcpy(modname, module_name(ctl), sizeof(modname));
17157 len = strlen(modname);
17158 if (len > 5 && strcmp(modname + len - 5, ".kmod") == 0)
17159 modname[len - 5] = '\0';
17160 template.dtpr_mod = modname;
17161
17162#endif
17163
17164 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17165#ifdef illumos
17166 mutex_enter(&mod_lock);
17167#endif
17168 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17169
17170#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17171 if (ctl->nenabled > 0) {
17172 /* Don't allow unloads if a probe is enabled. */
17173 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17174 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17175 *error = -1;
17176 printf(
17177 "kldunload: attempt to unload module that has DTrace probes enabled\n");
17178 return;
17179 }
17180#endif
17181
17182 if (dtrace_bymod == NULL) {
17183 /*
17184 * The DTrace module is loaded (obviously) but not attached;
17185 * we don't have any work to do.
17186 */
17187 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17188#ifdef illumos
17189 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
17190#endif
17191 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17192 return;
17193 }
17194
17195 for (probe = first = dtrace_hash_lookup(dtrace_bymod, &template);
17196 probe != NULL; probe = probe->dtpr_nextmod) {
17197 if (probe->dtpr_ecb != NULL) {
17198 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17199#ifdef illumos
17200 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
17201#endif
17202 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17203
17204 /*
17205 * This shouldn't _actually_ be possible -- we're
17206 * unloading a module that has an enabled probe in it.
17207 * (It's normally up to the provider to make sure that
17208 * this can't happen.) However, because dtps_enable()
17209 * doesn't have a failure mode, there can be an
17210 * enable/unload race. Upshot: we don't want to
17211 * assert, but we're not going to disable the
17212 * probe, either.
17213 */
17214 if (dtrace_err_verbose) {
17215#ifdef illumos
17216 cmn_err(CE_WARN, "unloaded module '%s' had "
17217 "enabled probes", ctl->mod_modname);
17218#else
17219 cmn_err(CE_WARN, "unloaded module '%s' had "
17220 "enabled probes", modname);
17221#endif
17222 }
17223
17224 return;
17225 }
17226 }
17227
17228 probe = first;
17229
17230 for (first = NULL; probe != NULL; probe = next) {
17231 ASSERT(dtrace_probes[probe->dtpr_id - 1] == probe);
17232
17233 dtrace_probes[probe->dtpr_id - 1] = NULL;
17234
17235 next = probe->dtpr_nextmod;
17236 dtrace_hash_remove(dtrace_bymod, probe);
17237 dtrace_hash_remove(dtrace_byfunc, probe);
17238 dtrace_hash_remove(dtrace_byname, probe);
17239
17240 if (first == NULL) {
17241 first = probe;
17242 probe->dtpr_nextmod = NULL;
17243 } else {
17244 probe->dtpr_nextmod = first;
17245 first = probe;
17246 }
17247 }
17248
17249 /*
17250 * We've removed all of the module's probes from the hash chains and
17251 * from the probe array. Now issue a dtrace_sync() to be sure that
17252 * everyone has cleared out from any probe array processing.
17253 */
17254 dtrace_sync();
17255
17256 for (probe = first; probe != NULL; probe = first) {
17257 first = probe->dtpr_nextmod;
17258 prov = probe->dtpr_provider;
17259 prov->dtpv_pops.dtps_destroy(prov->dtpv_arg, probe->dtpr_id,
17260 probe->dtpr_arg);
17261 kmem_free(probe->dtpr_mod, strlen(probe->dtpr_mod) + 1);
17262 kmem_free(probe->dtpr_func, strlen(probe->dtpr_func) + 1);
17263 kmem_free(probe->dtpr_name, strlen(probe->dtpr_name) + 1);
17264#ifdef illumos
17265 vmem_free(dtrace_arena, (void *)(uintptr_t)probe->dtpr_id, 1);
17266#endif
17267#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17268 free_unr(dtrace_arena, probe->dtpr_id);
17269#endif
17270#ifdef __NetBSD__
17271 vmem_free(dtrace_arena, (uintptr_t)probe->dtpr_id, 1);
17272#endif
17273 kmem_free(probe, sizeof (dtrace_probe_t));
17274 }
17275
17276 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17277#ifdef illumos
17278 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
17279#endif
17280 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17281}
17282
17283#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17284static void
17285dtrace_kld_load(void *arg __unused, linker_file_t lf)
17286{
17287
17288 dtrace_module_loaded(lf);
17289}
17290
17291static void
17292dtrace_kld_unload_try(void *arg __unused, linker_file_t lf, int *error)
17293{
17294
17295 if (*error != 0)
17296 /* We already have an error, so don't do anything. */
17297 return;
17298 dtrace_module_unloaded(lf, error);
17299}
17300#endif
17301
17302#ifdef illumos
17303static void
17304dtrace_suspend(void)
17305{
17306 dtrace_probe_foreach(offsetof(dtrace_pops_t, dtps_suspend));
17307}
17308
17309static void
17310dtrace_resume(void)
17311{
17312 dtrace_probe_foreach(offsetof(dtrace_pops_t, dtps_resume));
17313}
17314#endif
17315
17316static int
17317dtrace_cpu_setup(cpu_setup_t what, processorid_t cpu)
17318{
17319 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
17320 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17321
17322 switch (what) {
17323 case CPU_CONFIG: {
17324 dtrace_state_t *state;
17325 dtrace_optval_t *opt, rs, c;
17326
17327 /*
17328 * For now, we only allocate a new buffer for anonymous state.
17329 */
17330 if ((state = dtrace_anon.dta_state) == NULL)
17331 break;
17332
17333 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_ACTIVE)
17334 break;
17335
17336 opt = state->dts_options;
17337 c = opt[DTRACEOPT_CPU];
17338
17339 if (c != DTRACE_CPUALL && c != DTRACEOPT_UNSET && c != cpu)
17340 break;
17341
17342 /*
17343 * Regardless of what the actual policy is, we're going to
17344 * temporarily set our resize policy to be manual. We're
17345 * also going to temporarily set our CPU option to denote
17346 * the newly configured CPU.
17347 */
17348 rs = opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE];
17349 opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE] = DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE_MANUAL;
17350 opt[DTRACEOPT_CPU] = (dtrace_optval_t)cpu;
17351
17352 (void) dtrace_state_buffers(state);
17353
17354 opt[DTRACEOPT_BUFRESIZE] = rs;
17355 opt[DTRACEOPT_CPU] = c;
17356
17357 break;
17358 }
17359
17360 case CPU_UNCONFIG:
17361 /*
17362 * We don't free the buffer in the CPU_UNCONFIG case. (The
17363 * buffer will be freed when the consumer exits.)
17364 */
17365 break;
17366
17367 default:
17368 break;
17369 }
17370
17371 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17372 return (0);
17373}
17374
17375#ifdef illumos
17376static void
17377dtrace_cpu_setup_initial(processorid_t cpu)
17378{
17379 (void) dtrace_cpu_setup(CPU_CONFIG, cpu);
17380}
17381#endif
17382
17383static void
17384dtrace_toxrange_add(uintptr_t base, uintptr_t limit)
17385{
17386 if (dtrace_toxranges >= dtrace_toxranges_max) {
17387 int osize, nsize;
17388 dtrace_toxrange_t *range;
17389
17390 osize = dtrace_toxranges_max * sizeof (dtrace_toxrange_t);
17391
17392 if (osize == 0) {
17393 ASSERT(dtrace_toxrange == NULL);
17394 ASSERT(dtrace_toxranges_max == 0);
17395 dtrace_toxranges_max = 1;
17396 } else {
17397 dtrace_toxranges_max <<= 1;
17398 }
17399
17400 nsize = dtrace_toxranges_max * sizeof (dtrace_toxrange_t);
17401 range = kmem_zalloc(nsize, KM_SLEEP);
17402
17403 if (dtrace_toxrange != NULL) {
17404 ASSERT(osize != 0);
17405 bcopy(dtrace_toxrange, range, osize);
17406 kmem_free(dtrace_toxrange, osize);
17407 }
17408
17409 dtrace_toxrange = range;
17410 }
17411
17412 ASSERT(dtrace_toxrange[dtrace_toxranges].dtt_base == 0);
17413 ASSERT(dtrace_toxrange[dtrace_toxranges].dtt_limit == 0);
17414
17415 dtrace_toxrange[dtrace_toxranges].dtt_base = base;
17416 dtrace_toxrange[dtrace_toxranges].dtt_limit = limit;
17417 dtrace_toxranges++;
17418}
17419
17420static void
17421dtrace_getf_barrier()
17422{
17423#ifdef illumos
17424 /*
17425 * When we have unprivileged (that is, non-DTRACE_CRV_KERNEL) enablings
17426 * that contain calls to getf(), this routine will be called on every
17427 * closef() before either the underlying vnode is released or the
17428 * file_t itself is freed. By the time we are here, it is essential
17429 * that the file_t can no longer be accessed from a call to getf()
17430 * in probe context -- that assures that a dtrace_sync() can be used
17431 * to clear out any enablings referring to the old structures.
17432 */
17433 if (curthread->t_procp->p_zone->zone_dtrace_getf != 0 ||
17434 kcred->cr_zone->zone_dtrace_getf != 0)
17435 dtrace_sync();
17436#endif
17437}
17438
17439/*
17440 * DTrace Driver Cookbook Functions
17441 */
17442#ifdef illumos
17443/*ARGSUSED*/
17444static int
17445dtrace_attach(dev_info_t *devi, ddi_attach_cmd_t cmd)
17446{
17447 dtrace_provider_id_t id;
17448 dtrace_state_t *state = NULL;
17449 dtrace_enabling_t *enab;
17450
17451 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
17452 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17453 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17454
17455 if (ddi_soft_state_init(&dtrace_softstate,
17456 sizeof (dtrace_state_t), 0) != 0) {
17457 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "/dev/dtrace failed to initialize soft state");
17458 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17459 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17460 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17461 return (DDI_FAILURE);
17462 }
17463
17464 if (ddi_create_minor_node(devi, DTRACEMNR_DTRACE, S_IFCHR,
17465 DTRACEMNRN_DTRACE, DDI_PSEUDO, NULL) == DDI_FAILURE ||
17466 ddi_create_minor_node(devi, DTRACEMNR_HELPER, S_IFCHR,
17467 DTRACEMNRN_HELPER, DDI_PSEUDO, NULL) == DDI_FAILURE) {
17468 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "/dev/dtrace couldn't create minor nodes");
17469 ddi_remove_minor_node(devi, NULL);
17470 ddi_soft_state_fini(&dtrace_softstate);
17471 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17472 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17473 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17474 return (DDI_FAILURE);
17475 }
17476
17477 ddi_report_dev(devi);
17478 dtrace_devi = devi;
17479
17480 dtrace_modload = dtrace_module_loaded;
17481 dtrace_modunload = dtrace_module_unloaded;
17482 dtrace_cpu_init = dtrace_cpu_setup_initial;
17483 dtrace_helpers_cleanup = dtrace_helpers_destroy;
17484 dtrace_helpers_fork = dtrace_helpers_duplicate;
17485 dtrace_cpustart_init = dtrace_suspend;
17486 dtrace_cpustart_fini = dtrace_resume;
17487 dtrace_debugger_init = dtrace_suspend;
17488 dtrace_debugger_fini = dtrace_resume;
17489
17490 register_cpu_setup_func((cpu_setup_func_t *)dtrace_cpu_setup, NULL);
17491
17492 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
17493
17494 dtrace_arena = vmem_create("dtrace", (void *)1, UINT32_MAX, 1,
17495 NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, VM_SLEEP | VMC_IDENTIFIER);
17496 dtrace_minor = vmem_create("dtrace_minor", (void *)DTRACEMNRN_CLONE,
17497 UINT32_MAX - DTRACEMNRN_CLONE, 1, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0,
17498 VM_SLEEP | VMC_IDENTIFIER);
17499 dtrace_taskq = taskq_create("dtrace_taskq", 1, maxclsyspri,
17500 1, INT_MAX, 0);
17501
17502 dtrace_state_cache = kmem_cache_create("dtrace_state_cache",
17503 sizeof (dtrace_dstate_percpu_t) * NCPU, DTRACE_STATE_ALIGN,
17504 NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
17505
17506 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&cpu_lock));
17507 dtrace_bymod = dtrace_hash_create(offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_mod),
17508 offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_nextmod),
17509 offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_prevmod));
17510
17511 dtrace_byfunc = dtrace_hash_create(offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_func),
17512 offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_nextfunc),
17513 offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_prevfunc));
17514
17515 dtrace_byname = dtrace_hash_create(offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_name),
17516 offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_nextname),
17517 offsetof(dtrace_probe_t, dtpr_prevname));
17518
17519 if (dtrace_retain_max < 1) {
17520 cmn_err(CE_WARN, "illegal value (%lu) for dtrace_retain_max; "
17521 "setting to 1", dtrace_retain_max);
17522 dtrace_retain_max = 1;
17523 }
17524
17525 /*
17526 * Now discover our toxic ranges.
17527 */
17528 dtrace_toxic_ranges(dtrace_toxrange_add);
17529
17530 /*
17531 * Before we register ourselves as a provider to our own framework,
17532 * we would like to assert that dtrace_provider is NULL -- but that's
17533 * not true if we were loaded as a dependency of a DTrace provider.
17534 * Once we've registered, we can assert that dtrace_provider is our
17535 * pseudo provider.
17536 */
17537 (void) dtrace_register("dtrace", &dtrace_provider_attr,
17538 DTRACE_PRIV_NONE, 0, &dtrace_provider_ops, NULL, &id);
17539
17540 ASSERT(dtrace_provider != NULL);
17541 ASSERT((dtrace_provider_id_t)dtrace_provider == id);
17542
17543 dtrace_probeid_begin = dtrace_probe_create((dtrace_provider_id_t)
17544 dtrace_provider, NULL, NULL, "BEGIN", 0, NULL);
17545 dtrace_probeid_end = dtrace_probe_create((dtrace_provider_id_t)
17546 dtrace_provider, NULL, NULL, "END", 0, NULL);
17547 dtrace_probeid_error = dtrace_probe_create((dtrace_provider_id_t)
17548 dtrace_provider, NULL, NULL, "ERROR", 1, NULL);
17549
17550 dtrace_anon_property();
17551 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17552
17553 /*
17554 * If there are already providers, we must ask them to provide their
17555 * probes, and then match any anonymous enabling against them. Note
17556 * that there should be no other retained enablings at this time:
17557 * the only retained enablings at this time should be the anonymous
17558 * enabling.
17559 */
17560 if (dtrace_anon.dta_enabling != NULL) {
17561 ASSERT(dtrace_retained == dtrace_anon.dta_enabling);
17562
17563 dtrace_enabling_provide(NULL);
17564 state = dtrace_anon.dta_state;
17565
17566 /*
17567 * We couldn't hold cpu_lock across the above call to
17568 * dtrace_enabling_provide(), but we must hold it to actually
17569 * enable the probes. We have to drop all of our locks, pick
17570 * up cpu_lock, and regain our locks before matching the
17571 * retained anonymous enabling.
17572 */
17573 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17574 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17575
17576 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
17577 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17578 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17579
17580 if ((enab = dtrace_anon.dta_enabling) != NULL)
17581 (void) dtrace_enabling_match(enab, NULL);
17582
17583 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17584 }
17585
17586 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17587 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17588
17589 if (state != NULL) {
17590 /*
17591 * If we created any anonymous state, set it going now.
17592 */
17593 (void) dtrace_state_go(state, &dtrace_anon.dta_beganon);
17594 }
17595
17596 return (DDI_SUCCESS);
17597}
17598#endif
17599
17600#ifdef __NetBSD__
17601static dev_type_open(dtrace_open);
17602
17603/* Pseudo Device Entry points */
17604/* Just opens, clones to the fileops below */
17605const struct cdevsw dtrace_cdevsw = {
17606 .d_open = dtrace_open,
17607 .d_close = noclose,
17608 .d_read = noread,
17609 .d_write = nowrite,
17610 .d_ioctl = noioctl,
17611 .d_stop = nostop,
17612 .d_tty = notty,
17613 .d_poll = nopoll,
17614 .d_mmap = nommap,
17615 .d_kqfilter = nokqfilter,
17616 .d_discard = nodiscard,
17617 .d_flag = D_OTHER | D_MPSAFE
17618};
17619
17620static int dtrace_ioctl(struct file *fp, u_long cmd, void *data);
17621static int dtrace_close(struct file *fp);
17622
17623static const struct fileops dtrace_fileops = {
17624 .fo_read = fbadop_read,
17625 .fo_write = fbadop_write,
17626 .fo_ioctl = dtrace_ioctl,
17627 .fo_fcntl = fnullop_fcntl,
17628 .fo_poll = fnullop_poll,
17629 .fo_stat = fbadop_stat,
17630 .fo_close = dtrace_close,
17631 .fo_kqfilter = fnullop_kqfilter,
17632};
17633#endif
17634
17635#ifndef illumos
17636static void dtrace_dtr(void *);
17637#endif
17638
17639/*ARGSUSED*/
17640static int
17641#ifdef illumos
17642dtrace_open(dev_t *devp, int flag, int otyp, cred_t *cred_p)
17643#endif
17644#ifdef __FreeBSD_
17645dtrace_open(struct cdev *dev, int oflags, int devtype, struct thread *td)
17646#endif
17647#ifdef __NetBSD__
17648dtrace_open(dev_t dev, int flags, int mode, struct lwp *l)
17649#endif
17650{
17651 dtrace_state_t *state;
17652 uint32_t priv;
17653 uid_t uid;
17654 zoneid_t zoneid;
17655
17656#ifdef illumos
17657 if (getminor(*devp) == DTRACEMNRN_HELPER)
17658 return (0);
17659
17660 /*
17661 * If this wasn't an open with the "helper" minor, then it must be
17662 * the "dtrace" minor.
17663 */
17664 if (getminor(*devp) == DTRACEMNRN_DTRACE)
17665 return (ENXIO);
17666#endif
17667#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17668 cred_t *cred_p = NULL;
17669 cred_p = dev->si_cred;
17670
17671
17672#endif
17673#ifdef __NetBSD__
17674 cred_t *cred_p = NULL;
17675 struct file *fp;
17676 int fd;
17677 int res;
17678
17679 if ((res = fd_allocfile(&fp, &fd)) != 0)
17680 return res;
17681 cred_p = l->l_cred;
17682#endif
17683
17684 /*
17685 * If no DTRACE_PRIV_* bits are set in the credential, then the
17686 * caller lacks sufficient permission to do anything with DTrace.
17687 */
17688 dtrace_cred2priv(cred_p, &priv, &uid, &zoneid);
17689 if (priv == DTRACE_PRIV_NONE) {
17690 return (EACCES);
17691 }
17692
17693 /*
17694 * Ask all providers to provide all their probes.
17695 */
17696 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17697 dtrace_probe_provide(NULL, NULL);
17698 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17699
17700 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
17701 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17702 dtrace_opens++;
17703 dtrace_membar_producer();
17704
17705#ifdef illumos
17706 /*
17707 * If the kernel debugger is active (that is, if the kernel debugger
17708 * modified text in some way), we won't allow the open.
17709 */
17710 if (kdi_dtrace_set(KDI_DTSET_DTRACE_ACTIVATE) != 0) {
17711 dtrace_opens--;
17712 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17713 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17714 return (EBUSY);
17715 }
17716
17717 if (dtrace_helptrace_enable && dtrace_helptrace_buffer == NULL) {
17718 /*
17719 * If DTrace helper tracing is enabled, we need to allocate the
17720 * trace buffer and initialize the values.
17721 */
17722 dtrace_helptrace_buffer =
17723 kmem_zalloc(dtrace_helptrace_bufsize, KM_SLEEP);
17724 dtrace_helptrace_next = 0;
17725 dtrace_helptrace_wrapped = 0;
17726 dtrace_helptrace_enable = 0;
17727 }
17728 state = dtrace_state_create(devp, cred_p);
17729#endif
17730#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17731 state = dtrace_state_create(dev, NULL);
17732 devfs_set_cdevpriv(state, dtrace_dtr);
17733#endif
17734#ifdef __NetBSD__
17735 state = dtrace_state_create(&dev, cred_p);
17736#endif
17737
17738 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17739
17740 if (state == NULL) {
17741#ifdef illumos
17742 if (--dtrace_opens == 0 && dtrace_anon.dta_enabling == NULL)
17743 (void) kdi_dtrace_set(KDI_DTSET_DTRACE_DEACTIVATE);
17744#else
17745 --dtrace_opens;
17746#endif
17747 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17748 return (EAGAIN);
17749 }
17750
17751 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17752
17753#ifdef __NetBSD__
17754 return fd_clone(fp, fd, flags, &dtrace_fileops, state);
17755#else
17756 return (0);
17757#endif
17758}
17759
17760/*ARGSUSED*/
17761#ifdef illumos
17762static int
17763dtrace_close(dev_t dev, int flag, int otyp, cred_t *cred_p)
17764#endif
17765#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17766static void
17767dtrace_dtr(void *data)
17768#endif
17769#ifdef __NetBSD__
17770static int
17771dtrace_close(struct file *fp)
17772#endif
17773{
17774#ifdef illumos
17775 minor_t minor = getminor(dev);
17776 dtrace_state_t *state;
17777#endif
17778 dtrace_helptrace_t *buf = NULL;
17779
17780#ifdef illumos
17781 if (minor == DTRACEMNRN_HELPER)
17782 return (0);
17783
17784 state = ddi_get_soft_state(dtrace_softstate, minor);
17785#endif
17786#ifdef __FreeBSD__
17787 dtrace_state_t *state = data;
17788#endif
17789#ifdef __NetBSD__
17790 dtrace_state_t *state = (dtrace_state_t *)fp->f_data;
17791#endif
17792
17793 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
17794 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17795
17796#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
17797 if (state->dts_anon)
17798#else
17799 if (state != NULL && state->dts_anon)
17800#endif
17801 {
17802 /*
17803 * There is anonymous state. Destroy that first.
17804 */
17805 ASSERT(dtrace_anon.dta_state == NULL);
17806 dtrace_state_destroy(state->dts_anon);
17807 }
17808
17809 if (dtrace_helptrace_disable) {
17810 /*
17811 * If we have been told to disable helper tracing, set the
17812 * buffer to NULL before calling into dtrace_state_destroy();
17813 * we take advantage of its dtrace_sync() to know that no
17814 * CPU is in probe context with enabled helper tracing
17815 * after it returns.
17816 */
17817 buf = dtrace_helptrace_buffer;
17818 dtrace_helptrace_buffer = NULL;
17819 }
17820
17821#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
17822 dtrace_state_destroy(state);
17823#else
17824 if (state != NULL) {
17825 dtrace_state_destroy(state);
17826 kmem_free(state, 0);
17827 }
17828#endif
17829
17830 ASSERT(dtrace_opens > 0);
17831
17832#ifdef illumos
17833 /*
17834 * Only relinquish control of the kernel debugger interface when there
17835 * are no consumers and no anonymous enablings.
17836 */
17837 if (--dtrace_opens == 0 && dtrace_anon.dta_enabling == NULL)
17838 (void) kdi_dtrace_set(KDI_DTSET_DTRACE_DEACTIVATE);
17839#else
17840 --dtrace_opens;
17841#endif
17842
17843 if (buf != NULL) {
17844 kmem_free(buf, dtrace_helptrace_bufsize);
17845 dtrace_helptrace_disable = 0;
17846 }
17847
17848 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17849 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
17850
17851#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
17852 return (0);
17853#endif
17854}
17855
17856#ifdef illumos
17857/*ARGSUSED*/
17858static int
17859dtrace_ioctl_helper(int cmd, intptr_t arg, int *rv)
17860{
17861 int rval;
17862 dof_helper_t help, *dhp = NULL;
17863
17864 switch (cmd) {
17865 case DTRACEHIOC_ADDDOF:
17866 if (copyin((void *)arg, &help, sizeof (help)) != 0) {
17867 dtrace_dof_error(NULL, "failed to copyin DOF helper");
17868 return (EFAULT);
17869 }
17870
17871 dhp = &help;
17872 arg = (intptr_t)help.dofhp_dof;
17873 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
17874
17875 case DTRACEHIOC_ADD: {
17876 dof_hdr_t *dof = dtrace_dof_copyin(arg, &rval);
17877
17878 if (dof == NULL)
17879 return (rval);
17880
17881 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17882
17883 /*
17884 * dtrace_helper_slurp() takes responsibility for the dof --
17885 * it may free it now or it may save it and free it later.
17886 */
17887 if ((rval = dtrace_helper_slurp(dof, dhp)) != -1) {
17888 *rv = rval;
17889 rval = 0;
17890 } else {
17891 rval = EINVAL;
17892 }
17893
17894 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17895 return (rval);
17896 }
17897
17898 case DTRACEHIOC_REMOVE: {
17899 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17900 rval = dtrace_helper_destroygen(NULL, arg);
17901 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17902
17903 return (rval);
17904 }
17905
17906 default:
17907 break;
17908 }
17909
17910 return (ENOTTY);
17911}
17912
17913/*ARGSUSED*/
17914static int
17915dtrace_ioctl(dev_t dev, int cmd, intptr_t arg, int md, cred_t *cr, int *rv)
17916{
17917 minor_t minor = getminor(dev);
17918 dtrace_state_t *state;
17919 int rval;
17920
17921 if (minor == DTRACEMNRN_HELPER)
17922 return (dtrace_ioctl_helper(cmd, arg, rv));
17923
17924 state = ddi_get_soft_state(dtrace_softstate, minor);
17925
17926 if (state->dts_anon) {
17927 ASSERT(dtrace_anon.dta_state == NULL);
17928 state = state->dts_anon;
17929 }
17930
17931 switch (cmd) {
17932 case DTRACEIOC_PROVIDER: {
17933 dtrace_providerdesc_t pvd;
17934 dtrace_provider_t *pvp;
17935
17936 if (copyin((void *)arg, &pvd, sizeof (pvd)) != 0)
17937 return (EFAULT);
17938
17939 pvd.dtvd_name[DTRACE_PROVNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
17940 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17941
17942 for (pvp = dtrace_provider; pvp != NULL; pvp = pvp->dtpv_next) {
17943 if (strcmp(pvp->dtpv_name, pvd.dtvd_name) == 0)
17944 break;
17945 }
17946
17947 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
17948
17949 if (pvp == NULL)
17950 return (ESRCH);
17951
17952 bcopy(&pvp->dtpv_priv, &pvd.dtvd_priv, sizeof (dtrace_ppriv_t));
17953 bcopy(&pvp->dtpv_attr, &pvd.dtvd_attr, sizeof (dtrace_pattr_t));
17954
17955 if (copyout(&pvd, (void *)arg, sizeof (pvd)) != 0)
17956 return (EFAULT);
17957
17958 return (0);
17959 }
17960
17961 case DTRACEIOC_EPROBE: {
17962 dtrace_eprobedesc_t epdesc;
17963 dtrace_ecb_t *ecb;
17964 dtrace_action_t *act;
17965 void *buf;
17966 size_t size;
17967 uintptr_t dest;
17968 int nrecs;
17969
17970 if (copyin((void *)arg, &epdesc, sizeof (epdesc)) != 0)
17971 return (EFAULT);
17972
17973 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
17974
17975 if ((ecb = dtrace_epid2ecb(state, epdesc.dtepd_epid)) == NULL) {
17976 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17977 return (EINVAL);
17978 }
17979
17980 if (ecb->dte_probe == NULL) {
17981 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
17982 return (EINVAL);
17983 }
17984
17985 epdesc.dtepd_probeid = ecb->dte_probe->dtpr_id;
17986 epdesc.dtepd_uarg = ecb->dte_uarg;
17987 epdesc.dtepd_size = ecb->dte_size;
17988
17989 nrecs = epdesc.dtepd_nrecs;
17990 epdesc.dtepd_nrecs = 0;
17991 for (act = ecb->dte_action; act != NULL; act = act->dta_next) {
17992 if (DTRACEACT_ISAGG(act->dta_kind) || act->dta_intuple)
17993 continue;
17994
17995 epdesc.dtepd_nrecs++;
17996 }
17997
17998 /*
17999 * Now that we have the size, we need to allocate a temporary
18000 * buffer in which to store the complete description. We need
18001 * the temporary buffer to be able to drop dtrace_lock()
18002 * across the copyout(), below.
18003 */
18004 size = sizeof (dtrace_eprobedesc_t) +
18005 (epdesc.dtepd_nrecs * sizeof (dtrace_recdesc_t));
18006
18007 buf = kmem_alloc(size, KM_SLEEP);
18008 dest = (uintptr_t)buf;
18009
18010 bcopy(&epdesc, (void *)dest, sizeof (epdesc));
18011 dest += offsetof(dtrace_eprobedesc_t, dtepd_rec[0]);
18012
18013 for (act = ecb->dte_action; act != NULL; act = act->dta_next) {
18014 if (DTRACEACT_ISAGG(act->dta_kind) || act->dta_intuple)
18015 continue;
18016
18017 if (nrecs-- == 0)
18018 break;
18019
18020 bcopy(&act->dta_rec, (void *)dest,
18021 sizeof (dtrace_recdesc_t));
18022 dest += sizeof (dtrace_recdesc_t);
18023 }
18024
18025 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18026
18027 if (copyout(buf, (void *)arg, dest - (uintptr_t)buf) != 0) {
18028 kmem_free(buf, size);
18029 return (EFAULT);
18030 }
18031
18032 kmem_free(buf, size);
18033 return (0);
18034 }
18035
18036 case DTRACEIOC_AGGDESC: {
18037 dtrace_aggdesc_t aggdesc;
18038 dtrace_action_t *act;
18039 dtrace_aggregation_t *agg;
18040 int nrecs;
18041 uint32_t offs;
18042 dtrace_recdesc_t *lrec;
18043 void *buf;
18044 size_t size;
18045 uintptr_t dest;
18046
18047 if (copyin((void *)arg, &aggdesc, sizeof (aggdesc)) != 0)
18048 return (EFAULT);
18049
18050 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18051
18052 if ((agg = dtrace_aggid2agg(state, aggdesc.dtagd_id)) == NULL) {
18053 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18054 return (EINVAL);
18055 }
18056
18057 aggdesc.dtagd_epid = agg->dtag_ecb->dte_epid;
18058
18059 nrecs = aggdesc.dtagd_nrecs;
18060 aggdesc.dtagd_nrecs = 0;
18061
18062 offs = agg->dtag_base;
18063 lrec = &agg->dtag_action.dta_rec;
18064 aggdesc.dtagd_size = lrec->dtrd_offset + lrec->dtrd_size - offs;
18065
18066 for (act = agg->dtag_first; ; act = act->dta_next) {
18067 ASSERT(act->dta_intuple ||
18068 DTRACEACT_ISAGG(act->dta_kind));
18069
18070 /*
18071 * If this action has a record size of zero, it
18072 * denotes an argument to the aggregating action.
18073 * Because the presence of this record doesn't (or
18074 * shouldn't) affect the way the data is interpreted,
18075 * we don't copy it out to save user-level the
18076 * confusion of dealing with a zero-length record.
18077 */
18078 if (act->dta_rec.dtrd_size == 0) {
18079 ASSERT(agg->dtag_hasarg);
18080 continue;
18081 }
18082
18083 aggdesc.dtagd_nrecs++;
18084
18085 if (act == &agg->dtag_action)
18086 break;
18087 }
18088
18089 /*
18090 * Now that we have the size, we need to allocate a temporary
18091 * buffer in which to store the complete description. We need
18092 * the temporary buffer to be able to drop dtrace_lock()
18093 * across the copyout(), below.
18094 */
18095 size = sizeof (dtrace_aggdesc_t) +
18096 (aggdesc.dtagd_nrecs * sizeof (dtrace_recdesc_t));
18097
18098 buf = kmem_alloc(size, KM_SLEEP);
18099 dest = (uintptr_t)buf;
18100
18101 bcopy(&aggdesc, (void *)dest, sizeof (aggdesc));
18102 dest += offsetof(dtrace_aggdesc_t, dtagd_rec[0]);
18103
18104 for (act = agg->dtag_first; ; act = act->dta_next) {
18105 dtrace_recdesc_t rec = act->dta_rec;
18106
18107 /*
18108 * See the comment in the above loop for why we pass
18109 * over zero-length records.
18110 */
18111 if (rec.dtrd_size == 0) {
18112 ASSERT(agg->dtag_hasarg);
18113 continue;
18114 }
18115
18116 if (nrecs-- == 0)
18117 break;
18118
18119 rec.dtrd_offset -= offs;
18120 bcopy(&rec, (void *)dest, sizeof (rec));
18121 dest += sizeof (dtrace_recdesc_t);
18122
18123 if (act == &agg->dtag_action)
18124 break;
18125 }
18126
18127 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18128
18129 if (copyout(buf, (void *)arg, dest - (uintptr_t)buf) != 0) {
18130 kmem_free(buf, size);
18131 return (EFAULT);
18132 }
18133
18134 kmem_free(buf, size);
18135 return (0);
18136 }
18137
18138 case DTRACEIOC_ENABLE: {
18139 dof_hdr_t *dof;
18140 dtrace_enabling_t *enab = NULL;
18141 dtrace_vstate_t *vstate;
18142 int err = 0;
18143
18144 *rv = 0;
18145
18146 /*
18147 * If a NULL argument has been passed, we take this as our
18148 * cue to reevaluate our enablings.
18149 */
18150 if (arg == NULL) {
18151 dtrace_enabling_matchall();
18152
18153 return (0);
18154 }
18155
18156 if ((dof = dtrace_dof_copyin(arg, &rval)) == NULL)
18157 return (rval);
18158
18159 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
18160 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18161 vstate = &state->dts_vstate;
18162
18163 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE) {
18164 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18165 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18166 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
18167 return (EBUSY);
18168 }
18169
18170 if (dtrace_dof_slurp(dof, vstate, cr, &enab, 0, B_TRUE) != 0) {
18171 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18172 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18173 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
18174 return (EINVAL);
18175 }
18176
18177 if ((rval = dtrace_dof_options(dof, state)) != 0) {
18178 dtrace_enabling_destroy(enab);
18179 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18180 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18181 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
18182 return (rval);
18183 }
18184
18185 if ((err = dtrace_enabling_match(enab, rv)) == 0) {
18186 err = dtrace_enabling_retain(enab);
18187 } else {
18188 dtrace_enabling_destroy(enab);
18189 }
18190
18191 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18192 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18193 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
18194
18195 return (err);
18196 }
18197
18198 case DTRACEIOC_REPLICATE: {
18199 dtrace_repldesc_t desc;
18200 dtrace_probedesc_t *match = &desc.dtrpd_match;
18201 dtrace_probedesc_t *create = &desc.dtrpd_create;
18202 int err;
18203
18204 if (copyin((void *)arg, &desc, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18205 return (EFAULT);
18206
18207 match->dtpd_provider[DTRACE_PROVNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18208 match->dtpd_mod[DTRACE_MODNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18209 match->dtpd_func[DTRACE_FUNCNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18210 match->dtpd_name[DTRACE_NAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18211
18212 create->dtpd_provider[DTRACE_PROVNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18213 create->dtpd_mod[DTRACE_MODNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18214 create->dtpd_func[DTRACE_FUNCNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18215 create->dtpd_name[DTRACE_NAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18216
18217 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18218 err = dtrace_enabling_replicate(state, match, create);
18219 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18220
18221 return (err);
18222 }
18223
18224 case DTRACEIOC_PROBEMATCH:
18225 case DTRACEIOC_PROBES: {
18226 dtrace_probe_t *probe = NULL;
18227 dtrace_probedesc_t desc;
18228 dtrace_probekey_t pkey;
18229 dtrace_id_t i;
18230 int m = 0;
18231 uint32_t priv;
18232 uid_t uid;
18233 zoneid_t zoneid;
18234
18235 if (copyin((void *)arg, &desc, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18236 return (EFAULT);
18237
18238 desc.dtpd_provider[DTRACE_PROVNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18239 desc.dtpd_mod[DTRACE_MODNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18240 desc.dtpd_func[DTRACE_FUNCNAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18241 desc.dtpd_name[DTRACE_NAMELEN - 1] = '\0';
18242
18243 /*
18244 * Before we attempt to match this probe, we want to give
18245 * all providers the opportunity to provide it.
18246 */
18247 if (desc.dtpd_id == DTRACE_IDNONE) {
18248 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18249 dtrace_probe_provide(&desc, NULL);
18250 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18251 desc.dtpd_id++;
18252 }
18253
18254 if (cmd == DTRACEIOC_PROBEMATCH) {
18255 dtrace_probekey(&desc, &pkey);
18256 pkey.dtpk_id = DTRACE_IDNONE;
18257 }
18258
18259 dtrace_cred2priv(cr, &priv, &uid, &zoneid);
18260
18261 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18262
18263 if (cmd == DTRACEIOC_PROBEMATCH) {
18264 for (i = desc.dtpd_id; i <= dtrace_nprobes; i++) {
18265 if ((probe = dtrace_probes[i - 1]) != NULL &&
18266 (m = dtrace_match_probe(probe, &pkey,
18267 priv, uid, zoneid)) != 0)
18268 break;
18269 }
18270
18271 if (m < 0) {
18272 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18273 return (EINVAL);
18274 }
18275
18276 } else {
18277 for (i = desc.dtpd_id; i <= dtrace_nprobes; i++) {
18278 if ((probe = dtrace_probes[i - 1]) != NULL &&
18279 dtrace_match_priv(probe, priv, uid, zoneid))
18280 break;
18281 }
18282 }
18283
18284 if (probe == NULL) {
18285 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18286 return (ESRCH);
18287 }
18288
18289 dtrace_probe_description(probe, &desc);
18290 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18291
18292 if (copyout(&desc, (void *)arg, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18293 return (EFAULT);
18294
18295 return (0);
18296 }
18297
18298 case DTRACEIOC_PROBEARG: {
18299 dtrace_argdesc_t desc;
18300 dtrace_probe_t *probe;
18301 dtrace_provider_t *prov;
18302
18303 if (copyin((void *)arg, &desc, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18304 return (EFAULT);
18305
18306 if (desc.dtargd_id == DTRACE_IDNONE)
18307 return (EINVAL);
18308
18309 if (desc.dtargd_ndx == DTRACE_ARGNONE)
18310 return (EINVAL);
18311
18312 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18313 mutex_enter(&mod_lock);
18314 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18315
18316 if (desc.dtargd_id > dtrace_nprobes) {
18317 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18318 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
18319 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18320 return (EINVAL);
18321 }
18322
18323 if ((probe = dtrace_probes[desc.dtargd_id - 1]) == NULL) {
18324 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18325 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
18326 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18327 return (EINVAL);
18328 }
18329
18330 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18331
18332 prov = probe->dtpr_provider;
18333
18334 if (prov->dtpv_pops.dtps_getargdesc == NULL) {
18335 /*
18336 * There isn't any typed information for this probe.
18337 * Set the argument number to DTRACE_ARGNONE.
18338 */
18339 desc.dtargd_ndx = DTRACE_ARGNONE;
18340 } else {
18341 desc.dtargd_native[0] = '\0';
18342 desc.dtargd_xlate[0] = '\0';
18343 desc.dtargd_mapping = desc.dtargd_ndx;
18344
18345 prov->dtpv_pops.dtps_getargdesc(prov->dtpv_arg,
18346 probe->dtpr_id, probe->dtpr_arg, &desc);
18347 }
18348
18349 mutex_exit(&mod_lock);
18350 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18351
18352 if (copyout(&desc, (void *)arg, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18353 return (EFAULT);
18354
18355 return (0);
18356 }
18357
18358 case DTRACEIOC_GO: {
18359 processorid_t cpuid;
18360 rval = dtrace_state_go(state, &cpuid);
18361
18362 if (rval != 0)
18363 return (rval);
18364
18365 if (copyout(&cpuid, (void *)arg, sizeof (cpuid)) != 0)
18366 return (EFAULT);
18367
18368 return (0);
18369 }
18370
18371 case DTRACEIOC_STOP: {
18372 processorid_t cpuid;
18373
18374 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18375 rval = dtrace_state_stop(state, &cpuid);
18376 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18377
18378 if (rval != 0)
18379 return (rval);
18380
18381 if (copyout(&cpuid, (void *)arg, sizeof (cpuid)) != 0)
18382 return (EFAULT);
18383
18384 return (0);
18385 }
18386
18387 case DTRACEIOC_DOFGET: {
18388 dof_hdr_t hdr, *dof;
18389 uint64_t len;
18390
18391 if (copyin((void *)arg, &hdr, sizeof (hdr)) != 0)
18392 return (EFAULT);
18393
18394 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18395 dof = dtrace_dof_create(state);
18396 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18397
18398 len = MIN(hdr.dofh_loadsz, dof->dofh_loadsz);
18399 rval = copyout(dof, (void *)arg, len);
18400 dtrace_dof_destroy(dof);
18401
18402 return (rval == 0 ? 0 : EFAULT);
18403 }
18404
18405 case DTRACEIOC_AGGSNAP:
18406 case DTRACEIOC_BUFSNAP: {
18407 dtrace_bufdesc_t desc;
18408 caddr_t cached;
18409 dtrace_buffer_t *buf;
18410
18411 if (copyin((void *)arg, &desc, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18412 return (EFAULT);
18413
18414 if (desc.dtbd_cpu < 0 || desc.dtbd_cpu >= NCPU)
18415 return (EINVAL);
18416
18417 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18418
18419 if (cmd == DTRACEIOC_BUFSNAP) {
18420 buf = &state->dts_buffer[desc.dtbd_cpu];
18421 } else {
18422 buf = &state->dts_aggbuffer[desc.dtbd_cpu];
18423 }
18424
18425 if (buf->dtb_flags & (DTRACEBUF_RING | DTRACEBUF_FILL)) {
18426 size_t sz = buf->dtb_offset;
18427
18428 if (state->dts_activity != DTRACE_ACTIVITY_STOPPED) {
18429 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18430 return (EBUSY);
18431 }
18432
18433 /*
18434 * If this buffer has already been consumed, we're
18435 * going to indicate that there's nothing left here
18436 * to consume.
18437 */
18438 if (buf->dtb_flags & DTRACEBUF_CONSUMED) {
18439 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18440
18441 desc.dtbd_size = 0;
18442 desc.dtbd_drops = 0;
18443 desc.dtbd_errors = 0;
18444 desc.dtbd_oldest = 0;
18445 sz = sizeof (desc);
18446
18447 if (copyout(&desc, (void *)arg, sz) != 0)
18448 return (EFAULT);
18449
18450 return (0);
18451 }
18452
18453 /*
18454 * If this is a ring buffer that has wrapped, we want
18455 * to copy the whole thing out.
18456 */
18457 if (buf->dtb_flags & DTRACEBUF_WRAPPED) {
18458 dtrace_buffer_polish(buf);
18459 sz = buf->dtb_size;
18460 }
18461
18462 if (copyout(buf->dtb_tomax, desc.dtbd_data, sz) != 0) {
18463 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18464 return (EFAULT);
18465 }
18466
18467 desc.dtbd_size = sz;
18468 desc.dtbd_drops = buf->dtb_drops;
18469 desc.dtbd_errors = buf->dtb_errors;
18470 desc.dtbd_oldest = buf->dtb_xamot_offset;
18471 desc.dtbd_timestamp = dtrace_gethrtime();
18472
18473 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18474
18475 if (copyout(&desc, (void *)arg, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18476 return (EFAULT);
18477
18478 buf->dtb_flags |= DTRACEBUF_CONSUMED;
18479
18480 return (0);
18481 }
18482
18483 if (buf->dtb_tomax == NULL) {
18484 ASSERT(buf->dtb_xamot == NULL);
18485 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18486 return (ENOENT);
18487 }
18488
18489 cached = buf->dtb_tomax;
18490 ASSERT(!(buf->dtb_flags & DTRACEBUF_NOSWITCH));
18491
18492 dtrace_xcall(desc.dtbd_cpu,
18493 (dtrace_xcall_t)dtrace_buffer_switch, buf);
18494
18495 state->dts_errors += buf->dtb_xamot_errors;
18496
18497 /*
18498 * If the buffers did not actually switch, then the cross call
18499 * did not take place -- presumably because the given CPU is
18500 * not in the ready set. If this is the case, we'll return
18501 * ENOENT.
18502 */
18503 if (buf->dtb_tomax == cached) {
18504 ASSERT(buf->dtb_xamot != cached);
18505 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18506 return (ENOENT);
18507 }
18508
18509 ASSERT(cached == buf->dtb_xamot);
18510
18511 /*
18512 * We have our snapshot; now copy it out.
18513 */
18514 if (copyout(buf->dtb_xamot, desc.dtbd_data,
18515 buf->dtb_xamot_offset) != 0) {
18516 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18517 return (EFAULT);
18518 }
18519
18520 desc.dtbd_size = buf->dtb_xamot_offset;
18521 desc.dtbd_drops = buf->dtb_xamot_drops;
18522 desc.dtbd_errors = buf->dtb_xamot_errors;
18523 desc.dtbd_oldest = 0;
18524 desc.dtbd_timestamp = buf->dtb_switched;
18525
18526 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18527
18528 /*
18529 * Finally, copy out the buffer description.
18530 */
18531 if (copyout(&desc, (void *)arg, sizeof (desc)) != 0)
18532 return (EFAULT);
18533
18534 return (0);
18535 }
18536
18537 case DTRACEIOC_CONF: {
18538 dtrace_conf_t conf;
18539
18540 bzero(&conf, sizeof (conf));
18541 conf.dtc_difversion = DIF_VERSION;
18542 conf.dtc_difintregs = DIF_DIR_NREGS;
18543 conf.dtc_diftupregs = DIF_DTR_NREGS;
18544 conf.dtc_ctfmodel = CTF_MODEL_NATIVE;
18545
18546 if (copyout(&conf, (void *)arg, sizeof (conf)) != 0)
18547 return (EFAULT);
18548
18549 return (0);
18550 }
18551
18552 case DTRACEIOC_STATUS: {
18553 dtrace_status_t stat;
18554 dtrace_dstate_t *dstate;
18555 int i, j;
18556 uint64_t nerrs;
18557
18558 /*
18559 * See the comment in dtrace_state_deadman() for the reason
18560 * for setting dts_laststatus to INT64_MAX before setting
18561 * it to the correct value.
18562 */
18563 state->dts_laststatus = INT64_MAX;
18564 dtrace_membar_producer();
18565 state->dts_laststatus = dtrace_gethrtime();
18566
18567 bzero(&stat, sizeof (stat));
18568
18569 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18570
18571 if (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_INACTIVE) {
18572 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18573 return (ENOENT);
18574 }
18575
18576 if (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_DRAINING)
18577 stat.dtst_exiting = 1;
18578
18579 nerrs = state->dts_errors;
18580 dstate = &state->dts_vstate.dtvs_dynvars;
18581
18582 for (i = 0; i < NCPU; i++) {
18583 dtrace_dstate_percpu_t *dcpu = &dstate->dtds_percpu[i];
18584
18585 stat.dtst_dyndrops += dcpu->dtdsc_drops;
18586 stat.dtst_dyndrops_dirty += dcpu->dtdsc_dirty_drops;
18587 stat.dtst_dyndrops_rinsing += dcpu->dtdsc_rinsing_drops;
18588
18589 if (state->dts_buffer[i].dtb_flags & DTRACEBUF_FULL)
18590 stat.dtst_filled++;
18591
18592 nerrs += state->dts_buffer[i].dtb_errors;
18593
18594 for (j = 0; j < state->dts_nspeculations; j++) {
18595 dtrace_speculation_t *spec;
18596 dtrace_buffer_t *buf;
18597
18598 spec = &state->dts_speculations[j];
18599 buf = &spec->dtsp_buffer[i];
18600 stat.dtst_specdrops += buf->dtb_xamot_drops;
18601 }
18602 }
18603
18604 stat.dtst_specdrops_busy = state->dts_speculations_busy;
18605 stat.dtst_specdrops_unavail = state->dts_speculations_unavail;
18606 stat.dtst_stkstroverflows = state->dts_stkstroverflows;
18607 stat.dtst_dblerrors = state->dts_dblerrors;
18608 stat.dtst_killed =
18609 (state->dts_activity == DTRACE_ACTIVITY_KILLED);
18610 stat.dtst_errors = nerrs;
18611
18612 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18613
18614 if (copyout(&stat, (void *)arg, sizeof (stat)) != 0)
18615 return (EFAULT);
18616
18617 return (0);
18618 }
18619
18620 case DTRACEIOC_FORMAT: {
18621 dtrace_fmtdesc_t fmt;
18622 char *str;
18623 int len;
18624
18625 if (copyin((void *)arg, &fmt, sizeof (fmt)) != 0)
18626 return (EFAULT);
18627
18628 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18629
18630 if (fmt.dtfd_format == 0 ||
18631 fmt.dtfd_format > state->dts_nformats) {
18632 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18633 return (EINVAL);
18634 }
18635
18636 /*
18637 * Format strings are allocated contiguously and they are
18638 * never freed; if a format index is less than the number
18639 * of formats, we can assert that the format map is non-NULL
18640 * and that the format for the specified index is non-NULL.
18641 */
18642 ASSERT(state->dts_formats != NULL);
18643 str = state->dts_formats[fmt.dtfd_format - 1];
18644 ASSERT(str != NULL);
18645
18646 len = strlen(str) + 1;
18647
18648 if (len > fmt.dtfd_length) {
18649 fmt.dtfd_length = len;
18650
18651 if (copyout(&fmt, (void *)arg, sizeof (fmt)) != 0) {
18652 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18653 return (EINVAL);
18654 }
18655 } else {
18656 if (copyout(str, fmt.dtfd_string, len) != 0) {
18657 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18658 return (EINVAL);
18659 }
18660 }
18661
18662 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18663 return (0);
18664 }
18665
18666 default:
18667 break;
18668 }
18669
18670 return (ENOTTY);
18671}
18672
18673/*ARGSUSED*/
18674static int
18675dtrace_detach(dev_info_t *dip, ddi_detach_cmd_t cmd)
18676{
18677 dtrace_state_t *state;
18678
18679 switch (cmd) {
18680 case DDI_DETACH:
18681 break;
18682
18683 case DDI_SUSPEND:
18684 return (DDI_SUCCESS);
18685
18686 default:
18687 return (DDI_FAILURE);
18688 }
18689
18690 mutex_enter(&cpu_lock);
18691 mutex_enter(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18692 mutex_enter(&dtrace_lock);
18693
18694 ASSERT(dtrace_opens == 0);
18695
18696 if (dtrace_helpers > 0) {
18697 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18698 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18699 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18700 return (DDI_FAILURE);
18701 }
18702
18703 if (dtrace_unregister((dtrace_provider_id_t)dtrace_provider) != 0) {
18704 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18705 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18706 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18707 return (DDI_FAILURE);
18708 }
18709
18710 dtrace_provider = NULL;
18711
18712 if ((state = dtrace_anon_grab()) != NULL) {
18713 /*
18714 * If there were ECBs on this state, the provider should
18715 * have not been allowed to detach; assert that there is
18716 * none.
18717 */
18718 ASSERT(state->dts_necbs == 0);
18719 dtrace_state_destroy(state);
18720
18721 /*
18722 * If we're being detached with anonymous state, we need to
18723 * indicate to the kernel debugger that DTrace is now inactive.
18724 */
18725 (void) kdi_dtrace_set(KDI_DTSET_DTRACE_DEACTIVATE);
18726 }
18727
18728 bzero(&dtrace_anon, sizeof (dtrace_anon_t));
18729 unregister_cpu_setup_func((cpu_setup_func_t *)dtrace_cpu_setup, NULL);
18730 dtrace_cpu_init = NULL;
18731 dtrace_helpers_cleanup = NULL;
18732 dtrace_helpers_fork = NULL;
18733 dtrace_cpustart_init = NULL;
18734 dtrace_cpustart_fini = NULL;
18735 dtrace_debugger_init = NULL;
18736 dtrace_debugger_fini = NULL;
18737 dtrace_modload = NULL;
18738 dtrace_modunload = NULL;
18739
18740 ASSERT(dtrace_getf == 0);
18741 ASSERT(dtrace_closef == NULL);
18742
18743 mutex_exit(&cpu_lock);
18744
18745 kmem_free(dtrace_probes, dtrace_nprobes * sizeof (dtrace_probe_t *));
18746 dtrace_probes = NULL;
18747 dtrace_nprobes = 0;
18748
18749 dtrace_hash_destroy(dtrace_bymod);
18750 dtrace_hash_destroy(dtrace_byfunc);
18751 dtrace_hash_destroy(dtrace_byname);
18752 dtrace_bymod = NULL;
18753 dtrace_byfunc = NULL;
18754 dtrace_byname = NULL;
18755
18756 kmem_cache_destroy(dtrace_state_cache);
18757 vmem_destroy(dtrace_minor);
18758 vmem_destroy(dtrace_arena);
18759
18760 if (dtrace_toxrange != NULL) {
18761 kmem_free(dtrace_toxrange,
18762 dtrace_toxranges_max * sizeof (dtrace_toxrange_t));
18763 dtrace_toxrange = NULL;
18764 dtrace_toxranges = 0;
18765 dtrace_toxranges_max = 0;
18766 }
18767
18768 ddi_remove_minor_node(dtrace_devi, NULL);
18769 dtrace_devi = NULL;
18770
18771 ddi_soft_state_fini(&dtrace_softstate);
18772
18773 ASSERT(dtrace_vtime_references == 0);
18774 ASSERT(dtrace_opens == 0);
18775 ASSERT(dtrace_retained == NULL);
18776
18777 mutex_exit(&dtrace_lock);
18778 mutex_exit(&dtrace_provider_lock);
18779
18780 /*
18781 * We don't destroy the task queue until after we have dropped our
18782 * locks (taskq_destroy() may block on running tasks). To prevent
18783 * attempting to do work after we have effectively detached but before
18784 * the task queue has been destroyed, all tasks dispatched via the
18785 * task queue must check that DTrace is still attached before
18786 * performing any operation.
18787 */
18788 taskq_destroy(dtrace_taskq);
18789 dtrace_taskq = NULL;
18790
18791 return (DDI_SUCCESS);
18792}
18793#endif
18794
18795#ifdef illumos
18796/*ARGSUSED*/
18797static int
18798dtrace_info(dev_info_t *dip, ddi_info_cmd_t infocmd, void *arg, void **result)
18799{
18800 int error;
18801
18802 switch (infocmd) {
18803 case DDI_INFO_DEVT2DEVINFO:
18804 *result = (void *)dtrace_devi;
18805 error = DDI_SUCCESS;
18806 break;
18807 case DDI_INFO_DEVT2INSTANCE:
18808 *result = (void *)0;
18809 error = DDI_SUCCESS;
18810 break;
18811 default:
18812 error = DDI_FAILURE;
18813 }
18814 return (error);
18815}
18816#endif
18817
18818#ifdef illumos
18819static struct cb_ops dtrace_cb_ops = {
18820 dtrace_open, /* open */
18821 dtrace_close, /* close */
18822 nulldev, /* strategy */
18823 nulldev, /* print */
18824 nodev, /* dump */
18825 nodev, /* read */
18826 nodev, /* write */
18827 dtrace_ioctl, /* ioctl */
18828 nodev, /* devmap */
18829 nodev, /* mmap */
18830 nodev, /* segmap */
18831 nochpoll, /* poll */
18832 ddi_prop_op, /* cb_prop_op */
18833 0, /* streamtab */
18834 D_NEW | D_MP /* Driver compatibility flag */
18835};
18836
18837static struct dev_ops dtrace_ops = {
18838 DEVO_REV, /* devo_rev */
18839 0, /* refcnt */
18840 dtrace_info, /* get_dev_info */
18841 nulldev, /* identify */
18842 nulldev, /* probe */
18843 dtrace_attach, /* attach */
18844 dtrace_detach, /* detach */
18845 nodev, /* reset */
18846 &dtrace_cb_ops, /* driver operations */
18847 NULL, /* bus operations */
18848 nodev /* dev power */
18849};
18850
18851static struct modldrv modldrv = {
18852 &mod_driverops, /* module type (this is a pseudo driver) */
18853 "Dynamic Tracing", /* name of module */
18854 &dtrace_ops, /* driver ops */
18855};
18856
18857static struct modlinkage modlinkage = {
18858 MODREV_1,
18859 (void *)&modldrv,
18860 NULL
18861};
18862
18863int
18864_init(void)
18865{
18866 return (mod_install(&modlinkage));
18867}
18868
18869int
18870_info(struct modinfo *modinfop)
18871{
18872 return (mod_info(&modlinkage, modinfop));
18873}
18874
18875int
18876_fini(void)
18877{
18878 return (mod_remove(&modlinkage));
18879}
18880#endif
18881
18882#ifdef __FreeBSD__
18883static d_ioctl_t dtrace_ioctl;
18884static d_ioctl_t dtrace_ioctl_helper;
18885static void dtrace_load(void *);
18886static int dtrace_unload(void);
18887static struct cdev *dtrace_dev;
18888static struct cdev *helper_dev;
18889
18890void dtrace_invop_init(void);
18891void dtrace_invop_uninit(void);
18892
18893static struct cdevsw dtrace_cdevsw = {
18894 .d_version = D_VERSION,
18895 .d_ioctl = dtrace_ioctl,
18896 .d_open = dtrace_open,
18897 .d_name = "dtrace",
18898};
18899
18900static struct cdevsw helper_cdevsw = {
18901 .d_version = D_VERSION,
18902 .d_ioctl = dtrace_ioctl_helper,
18903 .d_name = "helper",
18904};
18905#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
18906
18907#ifdef __NetBSD__
18908void dtrace_invop_init(void);
18909void dtrace_invop_uninit(void);
18910
18911struct dtrace_state_worker {
18912 kmutex_t lock;
18913 kcondvar_t cv;
18914 void (*fn)(dtrace_state_t *);
18915 dtrace_state_t *state;
18916 int interval;
18917 lwp_t *lwp;
18918 bool exiting;
18919};
18920
18921static void
18922dtrace_state_worker_thread(void *vp)
18923{
18924 struct dtrace_state_worker *w = vp;
18925
18926 mutex_enter(&w->lock);
18927 while (!w->exiting) {
18928 int error;
18929
18930 error = cv_timedwait(&w->cv, &w->lock, w->interval);
18931 if (error == EWOULDBLOCK) {
18932 mutex_exit(&w->lock);
18933 w->fn(w->state);
18934 mutex_enter(&w->lock);
18935 }
18936 }
18937 mutex_exit(&w->lock);
18938 kthread_exit(0);
18939}
18940
18941struct dtrace_state_worker *
18942dtrace_state_worker_add(void (*fn)(dtrace_state_t *), dtrace_state_t *state,
18943 hrtime_t interval)
18944{
18945 struct dtrace_state_worker *w;
18946 int error __diagused;
18947
18948 w = kmem_alloc(sizeof(*w), KM_SLEEP);
18949 mutex_init(&w->lock, "dtrace", MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
18950 cv_init(&w->cv, "dtrace");
18951 w->interval = ((uintmax_t)hz * interval) / NANOSEC;
18952 w->fn = fn;
18953 w->state = state;
18954 w->exiting = false;
18955 error = kthread_create(PRI_NONE, KTHREAD_MPSAFE|KTHREAD_MUSTJOIN, NULL,
18956 dtrace_state_worker_thread, w, &w->lwp, "dtrace-state-worker");
18957 KASSERT(error == 0); /* XXX */
18958 return w;
18959}
18960
18961void
18962dtrace_state_worker_remove(struct dtrace_state_worker *w)
18963{
18964 int error __diagused;
18965
18966 KASSERT(!w->exiting);
18967 mutex_enter(&w->lock);
18968 w->exiting = true;
18969 cv_signal(&w->cv);
18970 mutex_exit(&w->lock);
18971 error = kthread_join(w->lwp);
18972 KASSERT(error == 0);
18973 cv_destroy(&w->cv);
18974 mutex_destroy(&w->lock);
18975 kmem_free(w, sizeof(*w));
18976}
18977
18978#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
18979
18980static void dtrace_load(void *);
18981static int dtrace_unload(void);
18982
18983#include <dtrace_anon.c>
18984#include <dtrace_ioctl.c>
18985#include <dtrace_load.c>
18986#include <dtrace_modevent.c>
18987#include <dtrace_sysctl.c>
18988#include <dtrace_unload.c>
18989#include <dtrace_vtime.c>
18990#include <dtrace_hacks.c>
18991#include <dtrace_isa.c>
18992
18993#ifdef __FreeBSD__
18994DEV_MODULE(dtrace, dtrace_modevent, NULL);
18995MODULE_VERSION(dtrace, 1);
18996MODULE_DEPEND(dtrace, opensolaris, 1, 1, 1);
18997#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
18998
18999#ifdef __NetBSD__
19000MODULE(MODULE_CLASS_MISC, dtrace, "solaris");
19001#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
